tag.name: cfswitch
tag.help: Used with cfcase and cfdefaultcase. Evaluates a passed expression and passes control to the cfcase tag that matches the expression result. You can optionally code a cfdefaultcase tag, which receives control if there is no matching cfcase tag value.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.help: Any CFML expression that yields a scalar value. CFML converts integers, real numbers, Booleans, and dates to numeric values.

tag.name: cfapplication
tag.help: Defines scoping for a application, enables or disables storing client variables, and specifies a client variable storage mechanism. By default, client variables are disabled. Also, enables session variables and sets timeouts for session and application variables. Session and application variables are stored in memory.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: alias for defaultdatasource

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of your application. This name can be up to 64 characters long. Required for application and session variables, optional for client variables

parameter.name: sessionmanagement
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes enables session variables. Default is No.

parameter.name: defaultdatasource
parameter.help: the default datasource for this enviroment

parameter.name: applicationtimeout
parameter.help: Enter the CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas, to specify the lifespan of application variables. The default value is specified in the Variables page of the Railo Administrator.

parameter.name: clientmanagement
parameter.help: Yes or No. Enables client variables. Default is No.

parameter.name: sessiontimeout
parameter.help: Enter the CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas, to specify the lifespan of session variables. The default value is specified in the Variables page of the Railo Administrator.

parameter.name: scriptprotect
parameter.help: Specifies whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks

parameter.name: clientstorage
parameter.help: Specifies how Railo stores client variables

parameter.name: setclientcookies
setdomaincookies
parameter.help: Yes or No. Sets the CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain, not just a single host. Applications that are running on clusters must set this value to Yes. The default is No.

tag.name: cfreturn
tag.help: Returns result values from a component method. Contains an expression returned as result of the function.

parameter.name: expr
parameter.help: An expression; the result of the function from which this tag is called.

tag.name: cfbreak
tag.help: Used to break out of a cfloop,cfwhile or cfforeach.

tag.name: cfmailparam
tag.help: Can either attach a file or add a header to a message. It is nested within a cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailparam tag within a cfmail tag.

parameter.name: remove
parameter.help: remove attachment from filesystem after the mail is sucessful sended

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the header. Header names are case insensitive. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the file attribute.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Attaches the specified file to the message. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the name attribute.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME media type of the part.

parameter.name: content
parameter.help: send given value as attachment

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Indicates the value of the header.

parameter.name: contentid
parameter.help: The Identifier for the attached file. This ID should be globally unique and is used to identify the file in an IMG or other tag in the mail body that references the file content.

parameter.name: disposition
parameter.help: How the attached file is to be handled. Can be one of the following: attachment: presents the file as an attachment. inline: displays the file contents in the message.

tag.name: cfreportparam
tag.help: Runs a predefined Crystal Reports report.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Variable name for data that is passed.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value of the data that is sent.

parameter.name: retryintervall
parameter.help: deprecated, alias for retryInterval

tag.name: cftransaction
tag.help: Groups multiple queries into a single unit. The cftransaction tag provides commit and rollback processing.

parameter.name: isolation
parameter.help: ODBC lock type.

tag.name: cfdirectory
tag.help: Handles interactions with directories.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Required for action = "list". Ignored by all other actions. Name of output query for directory listing.

parameter.name: recurse
parameter.help: Whether Railo performs the action on subdirectories

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: Optional for action = "list". Ignored by all other actions. File extension filter applied to returned names. For example: *m. Only one mask filter can be applied at a time.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Defines the action to be taken with directory(ies) specified in directory.

parameter.name: serverpassword
parameter.help: allow you to access filesystem, also when access is denied for your context

parameter.name: newdirectory
parameter.help: Required for action = "rename". Ignored by all other actions. The new name of the directory specified in the directory attribute.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Optional for action = "list". Ignored by all other actions. The query columns by which to sort the directory listing. Any combination of columns from query output can be specified in comma-separated list. You can specify ASC (ascending) or DESC (descending) as qualifiers for column names. ASC is the default

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: Used with action = "Create" to define the permissions for a directory on UNIX and Linux platforms. Ignored on Windows. Options correspond to the octal values of the UNIX chmod command. From left to right, permissions are assigned for owner, group, and other.

parameter.name: storage
parameter.help: only used for S3 Resources

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: The name of the directory to perform the action against.

parameter.name: acl
parameter.help: only used for S3 Resources

tag.name: cfrethrow
tag.help: Rethrows the currently active exception. Preserves the exception's cfcatch.type and cfcatch. agContext information.

tag.name: cflog
tag.help: Writes a message to a log file.

parameter.name: time
parameter.help: Specifies whether to log the system time.

parameter.name: date
parameter.help: Specifies whether to log the system date.

parameter.name: log
parameter.help: If you omit the file attribute, specifies the standard log file in which to write the message. Ignored if you specify a file attribute

parameter.name: thread
parameter.help: Specifies whether to log the thread ID. The thread ID identifies which internal service thread logged a message. Since a service thread normally services a CFML page request to completion, then moves on to the next queued request, the thread ID serves as a rough indication of which request logged a message. Leaving thread IDs turned on can help diagnose patterns of server activity.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type or severity of the message.

parameter.name: application
parameter.help: Specifies whether to log the application name if one has been specified in a cfapplication tag.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The message text to log.

tag.name: cfelse
tag.help: Used with cfelse and cfelseif, cfif lets you create simple and compound conditional statements in CFML. The value in the cfif tag can be any expression.

tag.name: cfinvokeargument
tag.help: Argument for the Invoke Tag

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: name of the argument

parameter.name: omit
parameter.help: Enables you to omit a parameter when invoking a web service

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: value of the argument

tag.name: cfreport
tag.help: Runs a predefined Crystal Reports report.

parameter.name: formula
parameter.help: Specifies one or more named formulas. Terminate each formula specification with a semicolon.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: The password that corresponds to a username required for database access. Overrides the default settings for the data source in the Railo Administrator.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The username required for entry into the database from which the report is created. Overrides the default settings for the data source in the Railo Administrator.

parameter.name: orderby
parameter.help: Orders results according to your specifications.

parameter.name: report
parameter.help: Specifies the report path. Store Crystal Reports files in the same directories as cfml templates.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: Specifies the path to the report definition file, relative to the web root.

tag.name: cfschedule
tag.help: Provides a programmatic interface to the scheduling engine. You can run a specified page at scheduled intervals with the option to write out static HTML pages. This lets you offer users access to pages that publish data, such as reports, without forcing users to wait while a database transaction is performed in order to populate the data on the page.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password if URL is protected.

parameter.name: returnvariable
parameter.help: return variable name of action list

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Username if URL is protected.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: Required when action = 'update'. The URL to be executed.

parameter.name: starttime
parameter.help: Required when creating tasks with action = 'update'. Enter a value in seconds. The time when scheduling of the task starts.

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Customizes the requestTimeOut for the task operation. Can be used to extend the default timeout for operations that require more time to execute.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: The port number on the server from which the task is being scheduled. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.help: The type of operation the scheduler performs when executing this task.

parameter.name: serverpassword
parameter.help: allow you to access filesystem, also when access is denied for your context

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port number on the proxy server from which the task is being requested. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

parameter.name: enddate
parameter.help: The date when the scheduled task ends.

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: Required with publish ='Yes' The path location for the published file.

parameter.name: publish
parameter.help: Specifies whether the result should be saved to a file.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: resolveurl
parameter.help: Specifies whether to resolve links in the result page to absolute references.

parameter.name: task
parameter.help: The name of the task to delete, update, or run.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.help: Required when creating tasks with action = 'update'. Interval at which task should be scheduled. Can be set in seconds or as Once, Daily, Weekly, and Monthly. The default interval is one hour. The minimum interval is one minute.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Required with publish ='Yes' A valid filename for the published file.

parameter.name: startdate
parameter.help: Required when action ='update'. The date when scheduling of the task should start.

parameter.name: endtime
parameter.help: The time when the scheduled task ends. Enter a value in seconds.

tag.name: cfform
tag.help: Builds a form with CFML custom control tags that provide more functionality than standard HTML form input elements.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: The name of the window or window frame to which the form output is sent.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The name of the page that executed when the form is submitted for processing.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help: Used for HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfform. If you specify an attribute and value, they are passed to the HTML code that is generated for the cfinput tag.

parameter.name: enablecab
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the form you are creating.

parameter.name: codebase
parameter.help: URL for a downloadable JRE plugin (for Internet exploroer only). Default is /CFIDE/classes/cf-j2re-win.cab.

parameter.name: onsubmit
parameter.help: JavaScript function to execute after other input validation returns. Use this attribute to execute JavaScript for preprocessing data before the form is submitted

parameter.name: preservedata
parameter.help: Optional. "Yes" or "No." Specifies whether to display the data that was entered into cfform controls in the action page. "Yes" resets the value of the control to the value submitted when the form is submitted to itself. This works as expected for the cftextinput and cfslider controls. This attribute can be used only if the form and action are on a single page, or if the action page has a form that contains controls with the same names as the corresponding controls on the form page.

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: other than post will ignored

parameter.name: enctype
parameter.help: The MIME type used to encode data sent by the POST method. The default value is application/x-www-form-urlencoded. It is recommended that you accept the default value. This attribute is included for compatibility with the HTML form tag.

parameter.name: archive
parameter.help: URL for a downloadable Java classes for controls.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show a descriptive name for the interface.

parameter.name: extends
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of one or more interfaces that this interface extends. Any CFC that implements an interface must also implement all the functions in the interfaces specified by this property. If an interface extends another interface, and the child interface specifies a function with the same name as one in the parent interface, both functions must have the same attributes; otherwise generates an error.

tag.name: cfwddx
tag.help: Serializes and de-serializes CFML data structures to the XML-based WDDX format. Generates JavaScript statements to instantiate JavaScript objects equivalent to the contents of a WDDX packet or some CFML data structures.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: The name of the variable to hold the output of the operation. This attribute is required for action = 'WDDX2CFML'. For all other actions, if this attribute is not provided, the result of the WDDX processing is outputted in the HTML stream.

parameter.name: input
parameter.help: The value to be processed.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Specifies the action taken by the cfwddx tag.

parameter.name: usetimezoneinfo
parameter.help: Indicates whether to output time-zone information when serializing CFML to WDDX. If time-zone information is taken into account, the hour-minute offset, as represented in the ISO8601 format, is calculated in the date-time output. If time-zone information is not taken into account, the local time is output. The default is Yes.

parameter.name: toplevelvariable
parameter.help: The name of the top-level JavaScript object created by the deserialization process. The object created is an instance of the WddxRecordset object, explained in WddxRecordset Object.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: The Password of the User

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The Name of the User

parameter.name: roles
parameter.help: The Roles of the User

tag.name: cfhttpparam
tag.help: Required for cfhttp POST operations, cfhttpparam is used to specify the parameters necessary to build a cfhttp POST.

parameter.name: mimetype
parameter.help: Applies to File type; invalid for all other types. Specifies the MIME media type of the file contents. The content type can include an identifier for the character encoding of the file; for example, text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 indicates that the file is HTML text in the ISO Latin-1 character encoding.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A variable name for the data being passed.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Required for type = "File".

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The transaction type.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Specifies the value of the URL, FormField, Cookie, File, or CGI variable being passed.

parameter.name: encoded
parameter.help: Applies to FormField and CGI types; ignored for all other types. Specifies whether to URLEncode the form field or header.

tag.name: cfargument
tag.help: Allows subtag data to be saved with the base tag. Applies only to custom tags.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the argument

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: default value of the argument

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: name to display (only used by components)

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: the type of the argumentany (array, binary, boolean, date, guid, numeric, query, string, struct, uuid)

parameter.name: passby
parameter.help: should the argument passed as reference (default) or as a value

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: is argument required or not

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: hint to the argument (only used by components)

tag.name: cfvideoplayerparam
tag.help: play a video

parameter.name: video
parameter.help: Path to the FLV file. Can be a URL or local file.

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: This is just an alias for the attribute preview.

parameter.name: author
parameter.help: Name of the author.

parameter.name: flash
parameter.help: Path to the SWF file. Can be a URL or local file.

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: Layer in which the video is displayed. (not supported yet)

parameter.name: preview
parameter.help: Path to a preview image for playlist and main video display. Can be URL or local file.

parameter.name: link
parameter.help: Displays a tiny image and allows linking to any target. (HTML link, Ajax etc.)

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Title of the video. Displayed in the playlist as the title.

parameter.name: show
parameter.help: Defines whether the video should be displayed or not.

tag.name: cftextinput
tag.help: Lets you place a single-line text entry box in a cfform. The tag also gives you control over font characteristics.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of the control.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Name of a JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes for italicized text, No for normal text. Default is No.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical spacing of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function used to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the routine, which should return TRUE if validation succeeds and FALSE otherwise. When used, the validate attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Yes or No. If Yes, the user must enter or change text. Default is No.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to display if validation fails.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Minimum value, maximum value range, separated by a comma. Valid only for numeric data.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for text.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Number of characters displayed before horizontal scroll bar displays.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height value of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes for boldface text, No for medium text. Default is No.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width value of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Initial value that displays in the text control.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help: The text to display if the page containing a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment value.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: The maximum length of text entered.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for the control. See bgColor for color options.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the cftextinput control.

tag.name: cfimport
tag.help: To import a JSP Taglibrary or a CFML Custom Tag Directory

parameter.name: taglib
parameter.help: Path to a custom tag libraray or a jsp tld

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.help:
Prefix by which to access the imported custom CFML tags JSP tags.
If you import a CFML custom tag directory and specify an empty value, "", for this attribute, you can call the custom tags without using a prefix. You must specify and use a prefix for a JSP tag library.

tag.name: cfoutput
tag.help: Displays the results of a database query or other operation. To nest cfoutput tags, see the "Usage" section.

parameter.name: groupcasesensitive
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to group by case. The default value is YES; case is considered while grouping. If the query attribute specifies a query object that was generated by a case-insensitive SQL query, set the groupCaseSensitive attribute to NO to keep the recordset intact.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows to display in the output section.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Specifies the row from which to start output.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: The name of the cfquery from which to draw data for the output section.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Specifies the query column to use when you group sets of records together. Use this attribute if you have retrieved a record set ordered on a certain query column. For example, if a record set is ordered according to "CustomerID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "CustomerID." The group attribute, which is case sensitive, eliminates adjacent duplicates when the data is sorted by the specified field. See the groupCaseSensitive attribute for information about specifying a case i nsensitive grouping.

tag.name: cfscript
tag.help: Encloses a code segment containing cfscript.

tag.name: cfmail
tag.help: Sends e-mail messages by an SMTP server.

parameter.name: wraptext
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid username.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.

parameter.name: to
parameter.help: The name of the e-mail message recipient.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: Character encoding of the mail message

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies extended type attributes for the message.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: The name of the cfquery from which to draw data for message(s) to send. Specify this attribute to send more than one mail message, or to send the results of a query within a message.

parameter.name: subject
parameter.help: The subject of the mail message. This field may be driven dynamically on a message-by-message basis

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Specifies the query column to use when you group sets of records together to send as an e-mail message. For example, if you send a set of billing statements to customers, you might group on "Customer_ID." The group attribute, which is case sensitive, eliminates adjacent duplicates when the data is sorted by the specified field. See the Usage section for exceptions.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: The number of seconds to wait before timing out the connection to the SMTP server.

parameter.name: groupcasesensitive
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to group with regard to case or not. The default value is YES; case is considered while grouping. If the query attribute specifies a query object that was generated by a case-insensitive SQL query, set the groupCaseSensitive attribute to NO to keep the recordset intact.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: The TCP/IP port on which the SMTP server listens for requests. This is normally 25.

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port number on the proxy server from which the object is requested. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid password.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help: alias for ssl

parameter.name: cc
parameter.help: Indicates addresses to copy the e-mail message to; "cc" stands for "carbon copy."

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: The address of the SMTP server to use for sending messages. If no server is specified, the server name specified in the Railo Administrator is used.

parameter.name: from
parameter.help: The sender of the e-mail message.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Specifies the row in the query to start from.

parameter.name: replyto
parameter.help: Address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of e-mail messages to send.

parameter.name: bcc
parameter.help: Indicates addresses to copy the e-mail message to, without listing them in the message header. "bcc" stands for "blind carbon copy."

parameter.name: mimeattach
parameter.help: Specifies the path of the file to be attached to the e-mail message. An attached file is MIME-encoded.

parameter.name: failto
parameter.help: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.

parameter.name: usessl
parameter.help: alias for ssl

parameter.name: usetls
parameter.help: alias for tls

parameter.name: starttls
parameter.help: alias for tls

parameter.name: mailerid
parameter.help: Specifies a mailer ID to be passed in the X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.

parameter.name: remove
parameter.help: remove all attachments from filesystem after the mail is sucessful sended

tag.name: cfexecute
tag.help: Enables developers to execute a process on a server computer.

parameter.name: outputfile
parameter.help: The file to which to direct the output of the program. If not specified, the output is displayed on the page from which it was called.

parameter.name: terminateontimeout
parameter.help: terminate execution of proccess when timeout occur

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable in which to put program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on page from which it was called.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The full pathname of the application to execute. Note: On Windows, you must specify the extension as part of the application's name. For example, myapp.exe,

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Indicates how long, in seconds, the executing thread waits for the spawned process. A timeout of 0 is equivalent to the non-blocking mode of executing. A very high timeout value is equivalent to a blocking mode of execution. The default is 0; therefore, the thread spawns a process and returns without waiting for the process to terminate.If no output file is specified, and the timeout value is 0, the program output is discarded.

parameter.name: arguments
parameter.help: Command-line arguments passed to the application.

tag.name: cfinclude
tag.help: Lets you embed references to pages in CFML. You can embed cfinclude tags recursively. For an additional method of encapsulating CFML

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: A logical path to an existing page.

tag.name: cfslider
tag.help: Used inside cfform, cfslider lets you place a slider control in a CFML form. A slider control is like a sliding volume control. The slider groove is the area over which the slider moves.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of slider label. See textColor for color options.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The name of a valid JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

parameter.name: vertical
parameter.help: Yes renders the slider in the browser vertically. No renders the slider horizontally. This is the default.

parameter.name: refreshlabel
parameter.help: Yes or No. If Yes, the label is not refreshed when the slider is moved. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes for italicized label text, No for normal text. Default is No.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin spacing above and below slider control, in pixels.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: A label that displays with the slider control.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: The name of a valid JavaScript function used to validate user input; in this case, a change to the default slider value.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: The values of the left and right slider range. The slider value displays as the slider is moved. Separate values by a comma.

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: A stylistic choice for the slider.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for label text.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal margin spacing to the left and right of slider control, in pixels.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the slider control, in pixels.

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Enter Yes for bold label text, No for medium text. Default is No.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the slider control, in pixels.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The starting slider setting. Must be within the values specified in range. Defaults to the minimum value specified in range.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment value.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help: The text to display if a page containing a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

parameter.name: tickmarkmajor
parameter.help: Yes to render major tickmarks in the slider scale. No for no major tickmarks. Default is No. Major tick marks are the marks that appear at the intervals specified by the Scale attribute.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for label text measured in points.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Slider label text color. Valid entries are: black, magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Unsigned integer. Defines the slider scale within the value of range.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the cfslider control.

tag.name: cfvideoplayer
tag.help: play a video

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: background color

parameter.name: thumbnails
parameter.help: using Thumbnails in playlist or not (alias for playlistThumbnails)

parameter.name: foreground
parameter.help: alias for fgcolor

parameter.name: thumbs
parameter.help: using Thumbnails in playlist or not (alias for playlistThumbnails)

parameter.name: download
parameter.help: Set this to true to show a download button in the player controlbar

parameter.name: playlistthumbnails
parameter.help: using Thumbnails in playlist or not

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: if multiple video are defined, you have to define if this videos should be break a part or played as a single video

parameter.name: foregroundcolor
parameter.help: alias for fgcolor

parameter.name: overstretch
parameter.help: Sets how to stretch images/movies to make them fit the display. Set this to true to stretch them proportionally to fill the display, fit to stretch them disproportionally and none to keep original dimensions

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help: attribute to pass natively vales to player

parameter.name: preview
parameter.help: set this to the path of a preview image.

parameter.name: fgcolor
parameter.help: foreground color

parameter.name: playlistsize
parameter.help: size of the playlist, if playlist is right of display this is the width otherwise the height

parameter.name: background
parameter.help: alias for bgcolor

parameter.name: video
parameter.help: path to Movie File (flv/mp4)

parameter.name: playlist
parameter.help: define if and where the playlist will be displayed

parameter.name: autostart
parameter.help: Set this to true in the player to automatically start playing when the page loads

parameter.name: backgroundcolor
parameter.help: alias for bgcolor

tag.name: cfprocessingdirective
tag.help: Suppresses extra white space and other output, produced by CFML within the tag's scope.

parameter.name: suppresswhitespace
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to suppress the white space and other output generated by the CFML tags within the cfprocessingdirective block.

parameter.name: pageencoding
parameter.help: A string literal; the character encoding to use to read the page. The value may be enclosed in single or double quotation marks, or none.

parameter.name: executionlog
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to write execution log or not.

tag.name: cftry
tag.help: Used with one or more cfcatch tags, the cftry tag lets you catch and process exceptions in CFML pages. Exceptions include events that disrupt the normal flow of instructions in a CFML page, such as failed database operations, missing include files, and developer-specified events.

tag.name: cfexit
tag.help: Used to: Abort the processing of the currently executing CFML custom tag, exit the template within the currently executing CFML custom tag and reexecute a section of code within the currently executing CFML custom tag

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: define a url or or a relative path on the local system to a file that should be transfered to a pdf

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Bookmark name for the section

parameter.name: srcfile
parameter.help: define a absolute path to a file that should be transfered to a pdf

parameter.name: useragent
parameter.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

parameter.name: mimetype
parameter.help: mimetype of the source (when attribute src or srcfile are defined)

parameter.name: authpassword
parameter.help: Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

parameter.name: authuser
parameter.help: User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

tag.name: cfobjectcache
tag.help: Flushes the query cache

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: name for variables for action size

parameter.name: filterignorecase
parameter.help: filter for the elements to delete

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: filter for the elements to delete

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Clears queries from the cache in the Application scope.

tag.name: cfsearch
tag.help: Executes searches against data indexed

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the search query.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of entries for index queries. If omitted, all rows are returned.

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: The logical collection name that is the target of the search operation or an external collection with fully qualified path.

parameter.name: external
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the criteria type for the search.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.help: Specifies the criteria for the search following the syntactic rules specified by type.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Specifies the first row number to be retrieved. Default is 1.

tag.name: cfgraphdata
tag.help: Specifies a data point to be displayed by a cfgraph tag.

parameter.name: color
parameter.help: The color to use when graphing the data point. The default is to use the values from the cfgraph tag colorlist attribute or the built-in default list of colors. Line graphs ignore this attribute.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: A URL to load when the user clicks the data point. This attribute works with Pie, Bar, and HorizontalBar charts. This attribute has an effect only if the graph is in Flash file format.

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: The item label for the data point. The item labels appear on the horizontal axis of Line and Bar charts, the vertical axis of Horizontal Bar charts, and in the legend of Pie charts.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to be represented by the data point.

tag.name: cfdbinfo
tag.help: Lets you retrieve information about a data source, including details about the database, tables, queries, procedures, foreign keys, indexes, and version information about the database, driver, and JDBC. This tag supports only JDBC drivers, and does not support ODBC-based drivers, including the Microsoft Access driver.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Datasource to use to connect to the database.

parameter.name: procedure
parameter.help: Name of the procedure from which you retrieve information.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name to use to refer to the result.

parameter.name: dbname
parameter.help: Name of the database

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: User name to connect to the database.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: Specifies a filter to retrieve information about specific tables, columns, or stored procedures

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Type of information to get

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password to connect to the database.

parameter.name: table
parameter.help: Name of the table from which you retrieve information.

tag.name: cfadmin
tag.help: Tag for the railo web/server administrator

tag.name: cfcontent
tag.help: Defines the MIME type returned by the current page. Optionally, lets you specify the name of a file to be returned with the page.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes allows download ranges, no forbids download range, default let it open for client.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: the variable name to the content to output as binary

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: The name of the file being retrieved

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Defines the File/ MIME content type returned by the current page.

parameter.name: deletefile
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes deletes the file after the download operation. Defaults to No. This attribute applies only if you specify a file with the file attribute.

parameter.name: reset
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes discards output that precedes the call to cfcontent. No preserves the output that precedes the call. Defaults to Yes. The reset and file attributes are mutually exclusive. If you specify a file, the reset attribute has no effect.

parameter.name: content
parameter.help: the content to output as binary

tag.name: cfcol
tag.help: Defines table column header, width, alignment, and text. Used only inside a cftable.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the column in characters (the default is 20). If the length of the data displayed exceeds the width value, the data is truncated to fit.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Double-quote delimited text that determines what displays in the column. The rules for the text attribute are identical to the rules for cfoutput sections; it can consist of a combination of literal text, HTML tags, and query record set field references. You can embed hyperlinks, image references, and input controls in columns.

parameter.name: header
parameter.help: The text for the column's header.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Column alignment, Left, Right, or Center.

tag.name: cffile
tag.help: Handles all interactions with files. The attributes you use with cffile depend on the value of the action attribute. For example, if the action = "write", use the attributes associated with writing a text file.

parameter.name: nameconflict
parameter.help: Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file in the directory.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Absolute pathname of file on web server. On Windows, use backward slashes; on UNIX, use forward slashes.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: Content of the file to be created.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Absolute pathname of file on web server.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: Character set name for the file contents.

parameter.name: accept
parameter.help: Limits the MIME types to accept. Comma-delimited list. For example, to permit JPG and Microsoft Word file uploads: accept = "image/jpg, application/msword" The browser uses file extension to determine file type.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of variable to contain contents of text file.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

parameter.name: serverpassword
parameter.help: allow you to access filesystem, also when access is denied for your context

parameter.name: addnewline
parameter.help: Yes: appends newline character to text written to file

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.help: One attribute (Windows) or a comma-delimited list of attributes (other platforms) to set on the file. If omitted, the file's attributes are maintained.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: Applies only to Solaris and HP-UX. Permissions. Octal values of UNIX chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

parameter.name: filefield
parameter.help: Name of form field used to select the file.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: Absolute pathname of directory or file on web server.

parameter.name: acl
parameter.help: only used for S3 Resources

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Name of the result value (default:cffile)

tag.name: cfinvoke
tag.help: Invokes component methods from within a page or component. You use this tag to reference a WSDL file and consume a web service from within a block of CFML code.

tag.name: cfcase
tag.help: Handle one case of a cfswicth

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: One or more constant values that cfswitch compares to the specified expression case-insensitive comparison. If a value matches the expression, cfswitch executes the code between the cfcase start and end tags. Separate multiple values with a comma or other delimiter, as specified in the delimiters parameter. Duplicate value attributes are not allowed and causes a runtime error.

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Specifies the character that separates multiple entries in a list of values.

tag.name: cfsilent
tag.help: Suppresses all output that is produced by the CFML within the tag's scope.

tag.name: cfldap
tag.help: Provides an interface to LDAP Lightweight Directory Access Protocol directory servers like the Netscape Directory Server.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: used when username is defined

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Specifies the scope of the search from the entry specified in the Start attribute for action = "Query".

parameter.name: sortcontrol
parameter.help: Specifies how to sort query results.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Specifies the character that cfldap uses to separate attribute values in multi-value attributes. This character is used by the query, add, and modify action attributes, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes. The default character is the comma (,).

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If no user name is specified, the LDAP connection is anonymous.

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: Specifies the distinguished name of the entry to be used to start the search.

parameter.name: rebind
parameter.help: If you set rebind to Yes, cfldap attempts to rebind the referral callback and reissue the query by the referred address using the original credentials. The default is No, which means referred connections are anonymous.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Defaults to 60 seconds.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port defaults to the standard LDAP port, 389.

parameter.name: returnasbinary
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of columns that are to be returned as binary values.

parameter.name: modifytype
parameter.help: Indicates whether to add, delete, or replace an attribute in a multi-value list of attributes.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help: The type of security to use

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: Host name "biff.upperlip.com" or IP address "192.1.2.225" of the LDAP server.

parameter.name: dn
parameter.help: Specifies the distinguished name for update actions.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Used in conjunction with action = "Query". Specifies the first row of the LDAP query to insert into the query. The default is 1.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Specifies the LDAP action.

parameter.name: filterfile
parameter.help: Specifies the name of a filter file and of the stanza tag within the file that contains the LDAP filter string specification. You can specify an absolute pathname or a simple filename to identify the file.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Indicates the attribute or attributes by which to sort query results. Use a comma to separate attributes.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: Specifies the character that cfldap uses to separate multiple attribute name/value pairs when more than one attribute is specified in the attribute attribute or the attribute that you want to use has the default delimiter character, which is the semicolon (;), such as mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en. The delimiter character is used by the query, add, and modify action attributes, and is used by cfldap to output multi-value attributes

parameter.name: referral
parameter.help: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name you assign to the LDAP query.

tag.name: cfcache
tag.help: Speeds up page rendering when dynamic content does not have to be retrieved each time a user accesses the page. To accomplish this, cfcache creates temporary files that contain the static HTML returned from a page. You can use cfcache for simple URLs and URLs that contain URL parameters.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: When required for basic authentication, a valid password.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: When required for basic authentication, a valid username.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Specifies the protocol used to create pages from cache. Either http:// or https://. The default is http://.

tag.name: cfstoredproc
tag.help: Executes stored procedures by an ODBC or native connection to a server database. It specifies database connection information and identifies the stored procedure.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: The name of an ODBC or native data source that points to the database that contains the stored procedure.

parameter.name: procedure
parameter.help: The name of the stored procedure on the database server.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Yes or No. Specifies whether debug info will be listed on each statement. Default is No.

parameter.name: cachename
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If specified, username overrides the username value specified in the data source setup.

parameter.name: cachedafter
parameter.help: This is the age of which the query data can be

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows to fetch at a time from the server. The range is 1 which is the default to 100. The ODBC driver may dynamically reduce the block factor at runtime.

parameter.name: returncode
parameter.help: Yes or No. Specifies whether the tag populates cfstoredproc.statusCode with the status code returned by the stored procedure. Default is No.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: timeout for the stored procedure.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: If specified, password overrides the password value specified in the data source setup.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfstoredproc returns the statusCode and ExecutionTime variables.

tag.name: cfupdate
tag.help: Updates existing records in data sources.

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: For data sources that support table ownership, for example, SQL Server, Oracle, and Sybase SQL Anywhere, use this field to specify the owner of the table.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of the data source that contains a table.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: If specified, password overrides the password value specified in the ODBC setup.

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help: Name of the table you want to update.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify the qualifier for the table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies across drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, the qualifier refers to the name of the database that contains the table. For the Intersolv dBase driver, the qualifier refers to the directory where the DBF files are located.

parameter.name: formfields
parameter.help: A comma-separated list of form fields to update. If this attribute is not specified, all fields in the form are included in the operation.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If specified, username overrides the username value specified in the ODBC setup.

tag.name: cfinsert
tag.help: Inserts records in data sources.

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: For data sources that support table ownership such as SQL Server, Oracle, and Sybase SQL Anywhere, use this field to specify the owner of the table.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of the data source that contains your table.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: If specified, password overrides the password value specified in the ODBC setup.

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help: Name of the table you want the form fields inserted in.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify the qualifier for the table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies across drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, the qualifier refers to the name of the database that contains the table. For the Intersolv dBase driver, the qualifier refers to the directory where the DBF files are located.

parameter.name: formfields
parameter.help: A comma-separated list of form fields to insert. If this attribute is not specified, all fields in the form are included in the operation.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If specified, username overrides the username value specified in the ODBC setup.

tag.name: cfftp
tag.help: Lets users implement File Transfer Protocol (FTP) operations.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: remote directory to list

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid username.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: The Password for the connection

parameter.name: failifexists
parameter.help: throw a error if local file already exist or overwrite it

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The Username for the connection

parameter.name: stoponerror
parameter.help: define if execution halt on error or not

parameter.name: transfermode
parameter.help: ascci, binary or auto mode

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: timeout for the connection

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: server port of the connection

parameter.name: remotefile
parameter.help: File on the Server

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Name of the result value (default:cfftp)

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: the name for the connection, used to cache the connection

parameter.name: retrycount
parameter.help: retry count

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port number on the proxy server from which the object is requested. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

parameter.name: asciiextensionlist
parameter.help: Delimited list of file extensions that force ASCII transfer mode, if transferMode = "auto".

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid password.

parameter.name: existing
parameter.help: source or existing file or directory to rename

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: The Server to connect

parameter.name: new
parameter.help: new name for file or directory

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: the action that should be execute

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: passive
parameter.help: enable passive mode

parameter.name: localfile
parameter.help: File on the current machine

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: item on the server

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: name of the query for list directory

tag.name: cfset
tag.help: Define a CFML variable. If the variable exists, cfset resets it to the specified value.

parameter.name: noname
parameter.help: Content of the tag set

tag.name: cffunction
tag.help: Defines table column header, width, alignment, and text. Used only inside a cftable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A string; a component method that is used within the cfcomponent tag.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help:
This attribute is used only for a component.
yes: the function is processed as if it were within a cfoutput tag no: the function is processed as if it were within a cfsilent tag

parameter.name: returntype
parameter.help: String; a type name; data type of the function return value

parameter.name: access
parameter.help: This attribute is used only for a component. The client security context from which the method can be invoked

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Hint of the Function

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: Display Name of the Function

parameter.name: roles
parameter.help: This attribute is used only for a component. If this attribute is omitted, all roles can invoke the method.

parameter.name: abstract
parameter.help: is the function abstract or not, abstract functions are only allowed inside interface or component tags

tag.name: cfvideo
tag.help: play a video

parameter.name: comment
parameter.help: comment meta data of the destinatin video

parameter.name: copyright
parameter.help: copyright meta data of the destinatin video

parameter.name: fps
parameter.help: how many frames are used per second

parameter.name: profile
parameter.help: standart profile definition (declared in video.xml)

parameter.name: author
parameter.help: author meta data of the destinatin video

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: offset of destination video based on source, you can defines frames (10f) or time (1145ms,3.123s)

parameter.name: videobitratemin
parameter.help: minimal video bitrate of variable bitrate, default same as input or part of defined quality (example: 10kbps, 10mbps, 10bps)

parameter.name: nameconflict
parameter.help: Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file in the directory. (error,skip,overwrite,makeunique)

parameter.name: videobitrate
parameter.help: video bitrate, default same as input or part of defined quality (example: 10kbps, 10mbps, 10bps)

parameter.name: videobitratemax
parameter.help: maximal video bitrate of variable bitrate, default same as input or part of defined quality (example: 10kbps, 10mbps, 10bps)

parameter.name: source2
parameter.help: "right" source video to read in for concatination

parameter.name: source1
parameter.help: "left" source video to read in for concatination

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: name of struct that hold action info (default:cfvideo)

parameter.name: quality
parameter.help: alias for profile

parameter.name: audiobitrate
parameter.help: audio bitrate, default same as input or part of defined quality (example: 10kbps, 10mbps, 10bps)

parameter.name: videocodec
parameter.help: force video codec

parameter.name: execution
parameter.help: values can be "quality" or "performance"

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: height of destination video

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: source video to read in

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: width of destination video

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: directory of the destination video to create

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Type of video manipulation that the tag performs. provided actions are [info,convert,cutimage,concat]

parameter.name: max
parameter.help: maximal length of destination video, you can defines max frame (10f) or max time (1145ms,3.123s)

parameter.name: aspectratio
parameter.help: aspect ratio (16:9,4:3)

parameter.name: framerate
parameter.help: how many frames are used per second (alias for fps)

parameter.name: audiosamplerate
parameter.help: audio sampling rate, default same as input or part of defined quality

parameter.name: videobitratetolerance
parameter.help: video bitrate tolerance of variable bitrate, default same as input or part of defined quality (example: 10kbps, 10mbps, 10bps)

parameter.name: audiocodec
parameter.help: force audio codec

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: for internal use only

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: title meta data of the destinatin video

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: name of the destination video

tag.name: cfmailpart
tag.help: Specifies one part of a multipart e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailpart tag within a cfmail tag

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME media type of the part

parameter.name: wraptext
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: The character encoding in which the part text is encoded

tag.name: cfif
tag.help: Used with cfelse and cfelseif, cfif lets you create simple and compound conditional statements in CFML. The value in the cfif tag can be any expression.

parameter.name: contition
parameter.help: Contition o the expression

tag.name: cfgridupdate
tag.help: Used in a cfgrid, cfgridupdate allows you to perform updates to data sources directly from edited grid data. The cfgridupdate tag provides a direct interface with your data source. The cfgridupdate tag applies delete row actions first, then INSERT row actions, and then UPDATE row actions. If an error is encountered, row processing stops.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: The name of the data source for the update action.

parameter.name: grid
parameter.help: The name of the cfgrid form element that is the source for the update action.

parameter.name: dbname
parameter.help: The database name (Sybase System 11 driver and SQLOLEDB provider only). If specified, dbName overrides the default database specified in the data source.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify the qualifier for the table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies across drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, the qualifier refers to the name of the database that contains the table. For the Intersolv dBase driver, the qualifier refers to the directory where the DBF files are located.

parameter.name: providerdsn
parameter.help: Data source name for the COM provider (OLE-DB only).

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If specified, username overrides the username value specified in the ODBC setup.

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help: The name of the table to update.

parameter.name: keyonly
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes specifies that in the update action, the WHERE criteria is confined to the key values. No specifies that in addition to the key values, the original values of any changed fields are included in the WHERE criteria. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: dbserver
parameter.help: For native database drivers and the SQLOLEDB provider, specifies the name of the database server computer. If specified, dbServer overrides the server specified in the data source.

parameter.name: connectstring
parameter.help: The contents of a connection string to send to the ODBC server. When connecting to a data source defined in the Railo Administrator, you can use this attribute to specify additional connection details or to override connection information specified in the Administrator. If you are dynamically connecting to a datasource by specifying dbType = "dynamic", the connection string must specify all required ODBC connection attributes.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.help: COM provider (OLE-DB only).

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: For data sources that support table ownership (such as SQL Server, Oracle, and Sybase SQL Anywhere), use this field to specify the owner of the table.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: If specified, password overrides the password value specified in the ODBC setup.

parameter.name: dbtype
parameter.help: The database driver type

tag.name: cfquery
tag.help: Passes SQL statements to a data source. Not limited to queries.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: If specified, password overrides the password value specified in the data source setup.

parameter.name: unique
parameter.help: Specifies if the object parameter is unique, used only for dbtype=orm or hql

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows to fetch at a time from the server. The range is 1, default to 100. This parameter applies to ORACLE native database drivers and to ODBC drivers. Certain ODBC drivers may dynamically reduce the block factor at runtime.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If specified, username overrides the username value specified in the data source setup.

parameter.name: dbserver
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: providerdsn
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: The name of the data source from which this query should retrieve data.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: The maximum number of milliseconds for the query to execute before returning an error indicating that the query has timed-out. This attribute is not supported by most ODBC drivers. timeout is supported by the SQL Server 6.x or above driver. The minimum and maximum allowable values vary, depending on the driver.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Used for debugging queries. Specifying this attribute causes the SQL statement submitted to the data source and the number of records returned from the query to be returned.

parameter.name: dbname
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: psq
parameter.help: preserve single quote or not

parameter.name: cachedafter
parameter.help: This is the age of which the query data can be

parameter.name: cachename
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows to return in the record set.

parameter.name: connectstring
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: dbtype
parameter.help: The database driver type.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name query. Must begin with a letter and may consist of letters, numbers, and the underscore character, spaces are not allowed. The query name is used later in the page to reference the query's record set.

tag.name: cfdefaultcase
tag.help: Handles interactions with directories.

parameter.name: mimetype
parameter.help: mimetype of the source (when attribute src or srcfile are defined)

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid username.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: define if a existing file will be overwritten or not

parameter.name: fontembed
parameter.help: define if fonts will embeded with the file

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.help: is the orientation landscape or portrait

parameter.name: pagetype
parameter.help: defined the used format for the page (,legal,letter,A4,A5,B4,B5,B4-JIS,B5-JIS and custom)

parameter.name: authuser
parameter.help: User name sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with password to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: define a url or or a relative path on the local system to a file that should be transfered to a pdf

parameter.name: bookmark
parameter.help: Specifies whether bookmarks are created in the document

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.help: define permissions for the file (AllowPrinting,AllowModifyContents,AllowCopy,AllowModifyAnnotations,AllowFillIn,AllowScreenReaders,AllowAssembly,AllowDegradedPrinting)

parameter.name: backgroundvisible
parameter.help: Specifies whether the background prints when the user prints the document

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port number on the proxy server from which the object is requested. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

parameter.name: pageheight
parameter.help: used when pagetype is custom

parameter.name: srcfile
parameter.help: define a absolute path to a file that should be transfered to a pdf

parameter.name: unit
parameter.help: set the unit for pageheight, pagewidth, and margin...

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid password.

parameter.name: localurl
parameter.help: Specifies whether to retrieve image files directly from the local drive

parameter.name: encryption
parameter.help: define if the outputshould be encrypted and how deep

parameter.name: authpassword
parameter.help: Password sent to the target URL for Basic Authentication. Combined with username to form a base64 encoded string that is passed in the Authenticate header. Does not provide support for Integrated Windows, NTLM, or Kerebos authentication.

parameter.name: proxyhost
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: pagewidth
parameter.help: used when pagetyp is custom

parameter.name: useragent
parameter.help: Text to put in the HTTP User-Agent request header field. Used to identify the request client software.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.help: name for output file, if not defined outputt will be written to response stream

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: alias for proxyHost

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: format of the created file

parameter.name: saveasname
parameter.help: (format="PDF" only) The filename that appears in the SaveAs dialog when a user saves a PDF file written to the browser.

parameter.name: htmlbookmark
parameter.help:
if true it is possible to convert to outlines a list of named anchors (label) or a headings structure (

...

). Transforming of HTML hyperlinks to PDF hyperlinks (if not explicitely disabled). Hyperlink jumps within the same document are supported as well

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: define a scale factor as a percentage. this option is used to reduce the size of the HTML output so that it fits on that paper. define a number less than 100.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: name of a variable to store the ouptut in it

tag.name: cftrace
tag.help: Displays and logs debugging data about the state of an application at the time the cftrace tag executes. Tracks runtime logic flow, variable values, and execution time. Displays output at the end of the request or in the debugging section at the end of the request; or, in Dreamweaver MX and later, in the Server Debug tab of the Results window.

tag.name: cfgridcolumn
tag.help: Used with cfgrid in a cfform, you use cfgridcolumn to specify column data in a cfgrid control. Font and alignment attributes used in cfgridcolumn override any global font or alignment settings defined in cfgrid.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Color value for the background of the grid column, or an expression you can use to manipulate grid column background color. Valid color entries are: black, magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white (default), lightgray, yellow.

parameter.name: values
parameter.help: Formats cells in the column as drop down list boxes. lets end users select an item in a drop down list. Use the values attribute to specify the items you want to appear in the drop down list.

parameter.name: headeralign
parameter.help: Alignment for the column header text. Default is as specified by cfgrid.

parameter.name: dataalign
parameter.help: Alignment for column data. Entries are: left, center, or right. Default is as specified by cfgrid.

parameter.name: valuesdelimiter
parameter.help: Character to use as a delimiter in the values and valuesDisplay attributes. Default is "," (comma).

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays all grid control text in italic. Default is as specified by the corresponding attribute of cfgrid.

parameter.name: hrefkey
parameter.help: The name of a query column when the grid uses a query. The column specified becomes the Key regardless of the select mode for the grid.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name to use for data in the column. Defaults is the font specified by cfgrid.

parameter.name: select
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes lets end users select a column in a grid control. When No, the column cannot be edited, even if the cfgrid insert or delete attributes are enabled. The value of the select attribute is ignored if the cfgrid selectMode attribute is set to Row or Browse.

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays all grid control text in boldface. Default is as specified by the corresponding attribute of cfgrid.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the column, in pixels. Default is the width of the column head text.

parameter.name: headerfontsize
parameter.help: Font size to use for the column header, in pixels. Default is as specified by the orresponding attribute of cfgrid.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: Yes or No. Use to hide columns. Default is Yes to display the column.

parameter.name: headertextcolor
parameter.help: Color value for the grid control column header text. Entries are: black (default), magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow.

parameter.name: header
parameter.help: Text for the column header. The value of header is used only when the cfgrid colHeaders attribute is Yes (or omitted, since it defaults to Yes).

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: URL to associate with the grid item. You can specify a URL that is relative to the current page

parameter.name: numberformat
parameter.help: The format for displaying numeric data in the grid. For information about mask characters, see "numberFormat mask characters".

parameter.name: headerfont
parameter.help: Font to use for the column header. Default is as specified by the corresponding attribute of cfgrid.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in the column. Default is the font specified by cfgrid.

parameter.name: headeritalic
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays column header text in italic. Default is as specified by the corresponding attribute of cfgrid.

parameter.name: headerbold
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays header text in boldface. Default is as specified by the corresponding attribute of cfgrid.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Color value for grid element text in the grid column, or an expression you can use to manipulate text color in grid column elements. Valid color entries are: black (default), magenta, cyan, orange, arkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: The name of the frame in which to open the link specified in href.

parameter.name: valuesdisplay
parameter.help: Used to map elements specified in the values attribute to a string of your choice to display in the drop down list. Enter comma separated strings and/or numeric range(s).

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the grid column element. If the grid uses a query, the column name must specify the name of a query column.

tag.name: cfcookie
tag.help: Defines cookie variables, including expiration and security options.

parameter.name: expires
parameter.help: Schedules the expiration of a cookie variable. Can be specified as a date (as in, 10/09/97), number of days (as in, 10, 100), "Now", or "Never". Using Now effectively deletes the cookie from the client browser.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the cookie variable.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value assigned to the cookie variable.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help: Yes or No. Specifies that the variable must transmit securely. If the browser does not support Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security, the cookie is not sent.

tag.name: cfservlet
tag.help: This tag has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: writeoutput
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: jrunproxy
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: code
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

tag.name: cfauthenticate
tag.help: Authenticates a user, setting a security context for the application. For more information, see the descriptions of IsAuthenticated and AuthenticatedContext.

tag.name: cfsavecontent
tag.help: Saves the generated content inside the tag body in a variable.

parameter.name: trim
parameter.help: trim result

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: The name of the variable in which to save the generated content inside the tag.

tag.name: cfcomponent
tag.help: Creates and defines a component object; encloses functionality that you build in CFML and enclose within cffunction tags. This tag contains one or more cffunction tags that define methods. Code within the body of this tag, other than cffunction tags, is executed when the component is instantiated.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Specifies whether a CFC used for web services uses RPC-encoded style or document-literal style

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: yes: permits component method output no: suppresses component method output

parameter.name: extends
parameter.help: Name of parent component from which to inherit methods and properties.

tag.name: cftree
tag.help: This Tag is not supported yet. Lets you put a tree control in a cfform. Validates user selections. Tree items are created with cftreeitem tags inside the cftree tag block. You can use a CFML query to supply data to the tree.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays tree control text in italic. Default is No.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin spacing above and below the tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: The name of a valid JavaScript function used to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return true if validation succeeds and false otherwise.

parameter.name: completepath
parameter.help: Yes passes the root level of the treename.path form variable when the cftree is submitted. If omitted or No, the root level of this form variable is not included. You must set this attribute to Yes for the preserveData attribute of cfform to work with the tree.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Yes or No. Whether user must select an item in the tree control. Default is No.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.

parameter.name: appendkey
parameter.help: Yes or No. When used with href, Yes passes the CFTREEITEMKEY variable along with the value of the selected tree item in the URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute. The default is Yes.

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: Stylistic choice for the slider.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name to use for data in the tree control.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays tree control text in boldface. Default is No.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: Places a border around the tree. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment value.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help: Text to display if the page containing a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

parameter.name: hscroll
parameter.help: Permits horizontal scrolling. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: fontsize
