parameter.help: Font size for text in the tree control, in points.

parameter.name: vscroll
parameter.help: Permits vertical scrolling. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: The character used to separate elements in the form variable path.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the cftree control.

tag.name: cfparam
tag.help: Tests for a parameter's existence, tests its data type, and provides a default value if one is not assigned.

parameter.name: max
parameter.help: define the biggest size of a numeric value, used for type range

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the parameter to test, such as Client.Email or Cookie.BackgroundColor. If you omit the DEFAULT attribute, an error occurs if the specified parameter does not exist

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: Default value to set the parameter to if it does not exist.

parameter.name: min
parameter.help: define the smallest size of a numeric value, used for type range

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type of parameter that is required. The default is 'any'.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: define a regular expression pattern, to check value against

tag.name: cftable
tag.help: Builds a table in a CFML page. Use the cfcol tag to define table column and row characteristics. The cftable tag renders data either as preformatted text, or, with the HTMLTable attribute, as an HTML table. Use cftable to create tables if you don't want to write HTML table tag code, or if your data can be well presented as preformatted text.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: Adds a border to the table. Use only when you specify the HTMLTable attribute for the table.

parameter.name: headerlines
parameter.help: Number of lines to use for the table header. The default is 2, which leaves one line between the headers and the first row of the table.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to display in the table.

parameter.name: htmltable
parameter.help: Renders the table as an HTML 3.0 table.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Specifies the query row from which to start processing.

parameter.name: colheaders
parameter.help: Displays headers for each column, as specified in the cfcol tag.

parameter.name: colspacing
parameter.help: Number of spaces to insert between columns 'default is 2'.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of the cfquery from which to draw data.

tag.name: cfapplet
tag.help: Used in a cfform tag, cfapplet lets you reference custom Java applets that you have registered using the Railo Administrator.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The form variable name for the applet.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the applet, in pixels.

parameter.name: appletsource
parameter.help: The name of the registered applet.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Space above and below applet, in pixels.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help: The text to display if a page containing a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

parameter.name: paramn
parameter.help: The name of a registered parameter for the applet.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The height of the applet, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Space on each side of the applet, in pixels.

tag.name: cfgrid
tag.help: Used inside cfform, cfgrid lets you place a grid control in a form. A grid control is a table of data divided into rows and columns. The cfgrid tag column data is specified with cfgridcolumn tags.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Target attribute for href URL.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width value of the grid control, in pixels.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Color value for text in the grid control. Options are: black (default), magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow. A hex value can be entered in the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx" where x is 0-9 or A-F. Use two pound signs or no pound signs.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help: Selection mode for items in the grid control.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height value of the grid control, in pixels.

parameter.name: autowidth
parameter.help: Optional. Yes or No. Default is No. If Yes, automatically sets the width of each column so that all the columns are visible within the grid's specified width. All columns are initially set to equal widths. Users can resize any column. No horizontal scroll bars are available since all columns are visible.

parameter.name: rowheaders
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays a column of numeric row labels in the grid control. Defaults to Yes.

parameter.name: colheaders
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays column headers in the grid control. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes displays grid control text in boldface. Default is No.

parameter.name: insertbutton
parameter.help: Text to use for the Insert action button. The default is Insert.

parameter.name: sortascendingbutton
parameter.help: Text to use for the Sort button. Default is "A - Z".

parameter.name: deletebutton
parameter.help: Text to use for the delete action button. The default is delete.

parameter.name: rowheaderbold
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays row label text in boldface. Default is No.

parameter.name: selectmode
parameter.help: Selection mode for items in the grid control.

parameter.name: insert
parameter.help: Yes lets end users insert row data into the grid. Default is No.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the grid element.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function used to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the routine, which should return True if validation succeeds and False otherwise.

parameter.name: gridlines
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes enables row and column rules (lines) in the grid control. No suppresses rules. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: colheaderfontsize
parameter.help: Size for column header text in the grid control, in points.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows to display in the grid.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes displays grid control text in italic. Default is No.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: URL to associate with the grid item or a query column for a grid that is populated from a query. If href is a query column, the href value is populated by the query. If href is not recognized as a query column, it is assumed that the href text is an actual HTML href.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in the grid control, in points.

parameter.name: picturebar
parameter.help: Yes or No. If Yes, images are used for the Insert, delete, and Sort buttons rather than text. Default is No.

parameter.name: rowheaderalign
parameter.help: Enter Left, Right, or Center to position data within a row header. Default is Left.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: Height value of the grid control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal margin spacing to the left and right of the grid control, in pixels.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

parameter.name: colheadertextcolor
parameter.help: Color value for the grid control column headers. Valid entries are: black (default), magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow.A hex value can be entered in the form: colHeaderTextColor = "##xxxxxx" where x is 0-9 or A-F. Use either two pound signs or no pound signs.

parameter.name: rowheight
parameter.help: Number of pixels for the minimum row height of the grid control. Used with cfgridcolumn type = "Image", you can use rowHeight to define enough space for graphics to display in the row.

parameter.name: rowheaderitalic
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays row label text in italic. Default is No.

parameter.name: griddataalign
parameter.help: Enter Left, Right, or Center to position data in the grid within a column. Default is Left.

parameter.name: colheaderfont
parameter.help: Font for the column header in the grid control.

parameter.name: colheaderalign
parameter.help: Enter Left, Right, or Center to position data within a column header. Default is Left.

parameter.name: delete
parameter.help: Yes lets end users delete row data from the grid. Default is No.

parameter.name: hrefkey
parameter.help: The name of a query column when the grid uses a query. The column specified becomes the Key regardless of the select mode for the grid.

parameter.name: rowheaderwidth
parameter.help: The width, in pixels, of the row header column.

parameter.name: colheaderitalic
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays column header text in italic. Default is No.

parameter.name: rowheadertextcolor
parameter.help: Text color value for the grid control row headers. Entries are: black (default), magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow. A hex value can be entered in the form: rowHeaderTextColor = "##xxxxxx" Where x is 0-9 or A-F. Use two pound signs or no pound signs.

parameter.name: selectcolor
parameter.help: Background color for a selected item. See bgColor for color options.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin spacing above and below the grid control, in pixels.

parameter.name: appendkey
parameter.help: When used with href, Yes passes query string value of the selected tree item in the URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: colheaderbold
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes displays column header text in boldface. Default is No.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment value. Options are: Top, Left, Bottom, Baseline, Texttop, Absbottom, Middle, Absmiddle, Right.

parameter.name: rowheaderfontsize
parameter.help: Size for row label text in the grid control, in points.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font to use for column data in the grid control.

parameter.name: highlighthref
parameter.help: Yes highlights links associated with a cfgrid with an href attribute value. No disables highlight. Default is Yes.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: If Yes, sort buttons are added to the grid control. When clicked, sort buttons perform a simple text sort on the selected column. Default is No. Note that columns are sortable by clicking the column head, even if no sort button is displayed.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of the query associated with the grid control.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color value for the grid control. Entries are: black, magenta, cyan, orange, darkgray, pink, gray, white, lightgray, yellow. A hex value can be entered in the form: bgColor = "##xxxxxx" where x is 0-9 or A-F. Use either two pound signs or no pound signs.

parameter.name: sortdescendingbutton
parameter.help: Text to use for the Sort button. Default is "Z - A".

parameter.name: rowheaderfont
parameter.help: Font to use for the row label.

tag.name: cfstopwatch
tag.help: Stops the time from starttag to endtag

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of variable to write time to it

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label of the stopwatch

tag.name: cfchartseries
tag.help: Used with the cfchart and cfchartseries tags. This tag defines chart data points. Its data is submitted to the cfchartseries tag.

tag.name: cfheader
tag.help: Generates custom HTTP response headers to return to the client.

parameter.name: statustext
parameter.help: Text that explains the status code. This attribute is used in conjunction with the statusCode attribute.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the header.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: A value for the HTTP header. This attribute is used in conjunction with the name attribute.

parameter.name: statuscode
parameter.help: A number that sets the HTTP status code.

tag.name: cfcatch
tag.help: Defines table column header, width, alignment, and text. Used only inside a cftable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: name for variable, by default it is cfcatch

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Type of catch, default:Any

tag.name: cfthrow
tag.help: The cfthrow tag raises a developer-specified exception that can be caught with cfcatch tag having any of the following type specifications - cfcatch type = 'custom_type', cfcatch type = 'Application' 'cfcatch' type = 'Any'

parameter.name: errorcode
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: object
parameter.help: a native java exception Object, if this attribute is defined all other will be ignored

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: A custom type or the predefined type Application. Do not enter any other predefined types because they are not generated by CFML applications. If you specify the exception type Application, you need not specify a type for cfcatch, because the Application type is the default cfcatch type

parameter.name: detail
parameter.help: A detailed description of the event. The CFML server appends the position of the error to this description; the server uses this parameter if an error is not caught by your code.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: A message that describes the exceptional event.

parameter.name: extendedinfo
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

tag.name: cfassociate
tag.help: Allows subtag data to be saved with the base tag. Applies only to custom tags.

parameter.name: datacollection
parameter.help: The name of the structure in which the base tag stores subtag data.

parameter.name: basetag
parameter.help: The name of the base tag.

tag.name: cfelseif
tag.help: Used with cfelse and cfelseif, cfif lets you create simple and compound conditional statements in CFML. The value in the cfif tag can be any expression.

parameter.name: contition
parameter.help: Expression Contition

tag.name: cfhttp
tag.help: Lets you execute HTTP POST and GET operations on files. Using cfhttp, you can execute standard GET operations and create a query object from a text file. POST operations lets you upload MIME file types to a server, or post cookie, formfield, URL, file, or CGI variables directly to a specified server.

parameter.name: addtoken
parameter.help: if yes add urltoken as cookie

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid username.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: When required by a server, a valid password.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.help: Specifies the column names for a query when creating a query as a result of a cfhttp GET.

parameter.name: textqualifier
parameter.help: Required for creating a query. Indicates the start and finish of a column. Should be appropriately escaped when embedded in a column. For example, if the qualifier is a double quotation mark, it should be escaped as """". If there is no text qualifier in the file, specify it as " ". Default is the double quotation mark (").

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: GET or POST. Use GET to download a text or binary file or to create a query from the contents of a text file. Use POST to send information to a server page or a CGI program for processing. POST requires the use of a cfhttpparam tag.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: set the charset for the call.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: When required by a server, a valid username.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: Full URL of the host name or IP address of the server on which the file resides. The URL must be an absolute URL, including the protocol (http or https) and hostname. It may optionally contain a port number. Port numbers specified in the url attribute override the port attribute.

parameter.name: throwonerror
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to throw an exception that can be caught by using the cftry and cfcatch tags. The default is NO.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: A value, in seconds. When a URL timeout is specified in the browser, the timeout attribute setting takes precedence over the Railo Administrator timeout. The server then uses the lesser of the URL timeout and the timeout passed in the timeout attribute, so that the request always times out before or at the same time as the page times out. If there is no URL timeout specified, Railo takes the lesser of the Railo Administrator timeout and the timeout passed in the timeout attribute. If there is no timeout set on the URL in the browser, no timeout set in the Railo Administrator, and no timeout set with the timeout attribute, Railo waits indefinitely for the cfhttp request to process.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: The port number on the server from which the object is requested. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document. If a port number is specified in the url attribute, the port value overrides the value of the port attribute.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: return variable name, default "cfhhtp"

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port number on the proxy server from which the object is requested. Default is 80. When used with resolveURL, the URLs of retrieved documents that specify a port number are automatically resolved to preserve links in the retrieved document.

parameter.name: redirect
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to redirect execution or stop execution. The default is Yes. If set to No and throwOnError = "yes", execution stops if cfhttp fails, and the status code and associated error message are returned in the variable cfhttp.statuscode. To see where execution would have been redirected, use the variable cfhttp.responseHeader[LOCATION]. The key LOCATION identifies the path of redirection. Railo will follow up to five redirections on a request. if this limit is exceeded, Railo behaves as if redirect = "no".

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: When required by a proxy server, a valid password.

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: The path to the directory in which a file is to be stored. If a path is not specified in a POST or GET operation, a variable is created (cfhttp.fileContent) that you can use to display the results of the POST operation in a cfoutput.

parameter.name: firstrowasheaders
parameter.help: sets if first row of csv is file

parameter.name: useragent
parameter.help: User agent request header.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: resolveurl
parameter.help: Yes or No. Default is No. For GET and POST operations, if Yes, page reference returned into the fileContent internal variable has its internal URLs fully resolved, including port number, so that links remain intact.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: The filename to be used for the file that is accessed. For GET operations, defaults to the name pecified in url. Enter path information in the path attribute.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: Required for creating a query. Options are a tab or comma. Default is a comma.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name to assign to a query if the a query is constructed from a file.

tag.name: cftreeitem
tag.help: Populates a tree control, created with cftree, with elements. You can use the img values supplied with CFML or reference your own icons.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: URL to associate with the tree item or a query column for a tree that is populated from a query. If href is a query column, the href value is the value populated by the query. If href is not recognized as a query column, it is assumed that the href text is an actual HTML href.

parameter.name: img
parameter.help: Image name or filename for the tree item. When populating a cftree with data from a cfquery, images or filenames for each level of the tree are specified in a comma-separated list.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Target attribute for href URL. When populating a cftree with data from a cfquery, targets are specified in a comma-separated list.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: The label for the tree item. Default is value. When populating a cftree with data from a cfquery, display names are specified in a comma-separated list.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Query name used to generate data for the treeitem.

parameter.name: queryasroot
parameter.help: Yes or No. Defines specified query as the root level. As in Example 1, this option avoids having to create an additional parent cftreeitem. If you specify a text string other than Yes or No, the tag uses the text as the root text.

parameter.name: imgopen
parameter.help: Icon displayed with open tree item. You can specify the icon filename using a relative path.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value passed when the cfform is submitted. When populating a cftree with data from a cfquery, columns are specified in a comma-separated list.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes expands tree to show tree item children. No keeps tree item collapsed. Default is Yes

parameter.name: parent
parameter.help: Value for tree item parent.

tag.name: cfforward
tag.help: forward the request to a other path.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: template path to forward to

tag.name: cfabort
tag.help: Stops processing of a page at the tag location. CFML returns everything that was processed before the cfabort tag. The cfabort tag is often used with conditional logic to stop processing a page when a condition occurs.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: define if only current page execution will aborted or the hole request. values are "page" for the curretn page or "request" for all.

parameter.name: showerror
parameter.help: The error to display when cfabort executes. The error message displays in the standard CFML error page.

tag.name: cflock
tag.help: Provides two types of locks to ensure the integrity of shared data: Exclusive lock and Read-only lock. An exclusive lock single-threads access to the CFML constructs in its body. Single-threaded access implies that the body of the tag can be executed by at most one request at a time. A request executing inside a cflock tag has an "exclusive lock" on the tag. No other requests can start executing inside the tag while a request has an exclusive lock. Railo issues exclusive locks on a first-come, first-served basis. A read-only lock allows multiple requests to access the CFML constructs inside its body concurrently. Therefore, read-only locks should be used only when the shared data is read only and not modified. If another request already has an exclusive lock on the shared data, the request waits for the exclusive lock to be released.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the lock. Only one request can execute inside a cflock tag with a given name. Therefore, providing the name attribute allows for synchronizing access to resources from different parts of an application. Lock names are global to a server. They are shared between applications and user sessions, but not across clustered servers. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the scope attribute. Therefore, do not specify the scope attribute and the name attribute in a tag. The value of name cannot be an empty string.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: readOnly or Exclusive. Specifies the type of lock: read-only or exclusive. Default is Exclusive. A read-only lock allows more than one request to read shared data. An exclusive lock allows only one request to read or write to shared data.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Specifies the scope as one of the following: Application, Server, or Session. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the name attribute.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait to obtain a lock. If a lock can be obtained within the specified period, execution continues inside the body of the tag. Otherwise, the behavior depends on the value of the throwOnTimeout attribute.

parameter.name: throwontimeout
parameter.help: Yes or No. Specifies how timeout conditions are handled. If the value is Yes, an exception is generated to provide notification of the timeout. If the value is No, execution continues past the cfclock tag. Default is Yes.

tag.name: cfregistry
tag.help: Reads, writes, and deletes keys and values in the system registry. The cfregistry tag is supported on all platforms, including Linux, Solaris, and HP-UX.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable into which to put value.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of record set to contain returned keys and values.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help:
Sorts query column data (case-insensitive). Sorts on Entry, Type, and Value columns as text. Specify a combination of columns from query output, in a comma-delimited list. For example: sort = "value desc, entry asc"
asc: ascending (a to z) sort order desc: descending (z to a) sort order

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: string: return string values dWord: return DWord values key: return keys any: return keys and values

parameter.name: branch
parameter.help: Name of a registry branch.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.help: Registry value to access.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: action to the registry

parameter.name: value
parameter.help:
Value data to set. If you omit this attribute, cfregistry creates default value, as follows:
string: creates an empty string: "" dWord: creates a value of 0 (zero)

tag.name: cfflush
tag.help: Flushes currently available data to the client.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.help: Flush the output each time at least the specified number of bytes become available. HTML headers, and any data that is already available when you make this call, are not included in the count.

parameter.name: copyfrom
parameter.help: Pathname of the PDF document from which to use the first page as a watermark

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: action to take

parameter.name: pages
parameter.help: Page or pages in the source PDF document on which to perform the action. You can specify multiple pages and page ranges as follows: "1,6-9,56-89,100, 110-120".

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: Image used as a watermark. You can specify a pathname, a variable that contains an image file, or a image variable

parameter.name: inputfiles
parameter.help: Structure that maps the PDF source files to the input variables in the DDX file, or a string of elements and their pathname.

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.help: type of permissions on the PDF document

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: PDF document variable name

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: Pathname of the modified PDF document. If the destination file exists, you must set the overwrite attribute to yes. If the destination file does not exist, CFML creates the file, if the parent directory exists.

parameter.name: showonprint
parameter.help: Specify whether to print the watermark with the PDF document

parameter.name: saveoption
parameter.help: Save options for the PDF output

parameter.name: ddxfile
parameter.help: Pathname of the DDX file, or a string with DDX instructions

parameter.name: newownerpassword
parameter.help: Password used to set permissions on a PDF document

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: PDF document used as the source.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Directory of the PDF documents to merge. You must specify either the directory attribute or the source attribute. If you specify the directory attribute, CFML orders the documents by filename in descending order, by default. To change the order of the files, use the order attribute.

parameter.name: ascending
parameter.help: Order in which the PDF files are sorted

parameter.name: flatten
parameter.help: Applies to forms created in Acrobat only (not forms created in LiveCycle); specifies whether interactivity is turned off

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: File type of thumbnail image output

parameter.name: keepbookmark
parameter.help: Specifies whether bookmarks from the source PDF documents are retained in the merged document

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.help: Degree of rotation of the watermark image on the page.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Size of the thumbnail relative to the source page. The value represents a percentage from 1 through 100.

parameter.name: outputfiles
parameter.help: Structure that contains the output files in the DDX file or string as keys and the pathname to the result file as the value.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Owner or user password of the source PDF document, if the document is password-protected.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: file filter, used with attribute directory

parameter.name: foreground
parameter.help: Placement of the watermark on the page

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Order in which the PDF documents in the directory are merged

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: Position on the page where the watermark is placed. The position represents the top-left corner of the watermark. Specify the x and y coordinates; for example "50,30".

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Specifies whether PDF output overwrites the destination file

parameter.name: resolution
parameter.help: Image quality used to generate thumbnail images

parameter.name: newuserpassword
parameter.help: Password used to open PDF document

parameter.name: transparent
parameter.help: (format="png" only) Specifies whether the image background is transparent or opaque

parameter.name: imageprefix
parameter.help: prefix used for each image thumbnail file generated. The image filenames use the format: imagePrefix_page_n.format.

parameter.name: opacity
parameter.help: Opacity of the watermark. Valid values are integers in the range 0 (transparent) through 10 (opaque).

parameter.name: isbase64
parameter.help: Valid only when the image attribute is specified. Specifies whether the image used as a watermark is in Base64 format

parameter.name: version
parameter.help: Version of the PDF used to write the document

parameter.name: info
parameter.help: Structure variable for relevant information

parameter.name: encrypt
parameter.help: Encryption type for the PDF output file

parameter.name: stoponerror
parameter.help: Valid only if the directory attribute is specified. If the specified directory contains files other then readable PDF files, Railo either stops merge process or continues.

tag.name: cfcollection
tag.help: Allows you to create and administer Search collections.

parameter.name: categories
parameter.help: Used only for creating a collection

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Specifies the action to perform.

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: Specifies a collection name or an alias if action = "map"

tag.name: cfprocresult
tag.help: Specifies a result set name that other tags, such as cfoutput and cftable, use to access the result set. It also lets you optionally identify which of the stored procedure's result sets to return. The cfprocresult tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the query result set.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum number of rows returned in the result set. The default is to return all rows in the result set.

parameter.name: resultset
parameter.help: Identifies the desired result set if the stored procedure returns multiple result sets. Default is 1.

tag.name: cfproperty
tag.help: Defines components as complex types that are used for web services authoring. The attributes of this tag are exposed as component metadata and are subject to inheritance rules.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A string; a property name. Must be a static value.

parameter.name: access
parameter.help: The client security context from which the method can be invoked

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: A string; a property type name; data type.

tag.name: cfloop
tag.help: Looping is a very powerful programming technique that lets you repeat a set of instructions or display output repeatedly until one or more conditions are met. cfloop supports five types of loops.

parameter.name: endline
parameter.help: end line

parameter.name: to
parameter.help: Ending value of index.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: charset for read the file

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Query that controls the loop.

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Character(s) that separates items in list

parameter.name: step
parameter.help: Step by which to increment or decrement the index value.

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: Index value. Railo sets it to from value and increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to value.

parameter.name: endrow
parameter.help: Last row of query that is included in the loop.

parameter.name: startline
parameter.help: start line

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: Collection to loop over

parameter.name: from
parameter.help: Beginning value of index.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: First row of query that is included in the loop.

parameter.name: condition
parameter.help: Condition that controls the loop.

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: A list, variable, or file name; contains a list

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: Key for the collection

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: file path

tag.name: cferror
tag.help: Enables the display of customized HTML pages when errors occur. This lets you maintain a consistent look and feel within your application, even when errors occur.

parameter.name: mailto
parameter.help: The e-mail address of the administrator to notify of the error. The value is available to your custom error page in the MailTo property of the error object.

parameter.name: exception
parameter.help: Type of exception. Required if type = "exception" or "monitor".

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type of error that the custom error page handles.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: The relative path to the custom error page.

tag.name: cfsetting
tag.help: Controls various aspects of page processing, such as the output of HTML code in pages. One benefit of this option is managing whitespace that can occur in output pages served by CFML.

parameter.name: enablecfoutputonly
parameter.help: Yes or No. When set to Yes, cfsetting blocks output of HTML that resides outside cfoutput tags.

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Integer; number of seconds. Time limit, after which CFML processes the page as an unresponsive thread. Overrides the timeout set in the Railo Administrator.

parameter.name: showdebugoutput
parameter.help: Yes or No. When set to No, showDebugOutput suppresses debugging information that would otherwise display at the end of the generated page.Default is Yes.

tag.name: cfimage
tag.help: Lets you resize and add labels to GIF and JPEG format images.

parameter.name: thickness
parameter.help: Border thickness in pixels. The border is added to the outside edge of the source image, increasing the image area accordingly.

parameter.name: isbase64
parameter.help: Specifies whether the source is a Base64 string

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: If the destination file already exists, Railo generates an error if the overwrite action is not set to yes.

parameter.name: fonts
parameter.help: One or more valid fonts to use for the CAPTCHA text. Separate multiple fonts with commas. Railo supports only the system fonts that the JDK can recognize. For example, TTF fonts in the Windows directory are supported on Windows.

parameter.name: structname
parameter.help: Name of the structure to be created.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Name of the structure to be created (alias for structname).

parameter.name: quality
parameter.help: Quality of the JPEG destination file. Applies only to files with an extension of JPG or JPEG. Valid values are fractions that range from 0 through 1 (the lower the number, the lower the quality).

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text string displayed in the CAPTCHA image. Use capital letters for better readability. Do not include spaces because users cannot detect them in the resulting CAPTCHA image.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help: HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfimage. If you specify an attribute and value, they are passed to the tag "img".

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height in pixels of the image. For the resize attribute, you also can specify the height as a percentage. When you resize an image, if you specify a value for the width.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width in pixels of the image.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: source file

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: Absolute or relative pathname where the image output is written. The image format is determined by the file extension. The convert and write actions require a destination attribute. The border, captcha, resize, and rotate actions require a name attribute or a destination attribute. You can specify both. If you do not enter a destination, the CAPTCHA image is placed inline in the HTML output and displayed in the web browser.

parameter.name: color
parameter.help: Border color. Hexadecimal value or supported named color. For a hexadecimal value, use the form "#xxxxxx" or "xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Action to execute. Must be one of the following: border, captcha, convert, info, read, resize, rotate, write, writeToBrowser The default action is read, which you do not need to specify explicitly.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: Format of the image displayed in the browser. If you do not specify a format, the image is displayed in PNG format.

parameter.name: difficulty
parameter.help: Level of complexity of the CAPTCHA text. Specify one of the following levels of text distortion: low, medium, high

parameter.name: angle
parameter.help: Angle in degrees to rotate the image.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: font size of the text in the CAPTCHA image.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the image variable to create. The read action requires a name attribute. The border, resize, and rotate actions require a name attribute or a destination attribute. You can specify both.

tag.name: cfobject
tag.help: Lets you call methods in COM, CORBA, and JAVA objects.

tag.name: cfgraph
tag.help: Displays a graphical representation of data.

parameter.name: showvaluelabel
parameter.help: Specifies whether values are displayed for the data points.

parameter.name: graphwidth
parameter.help: Width of the graph, in pixels. Default is 320.

parameter.name: scaleto
parameter.help: The maximum value of the graph value axis.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Type of chart to display.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: A URL to load when the user clicks any data point on the chart.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of the query containing the data to graph. Required if you do not use cfgraphdata tags in the cfgraph tag body to specify the data values.

parameter.name: valuelabelfont
parameter.help: The font used to display data values.

parameter.name: valuelabelsize
parameter.help: The size the value text, in points.

parameter.name: titlefont
parameter.help: The font used to display the title.

parameter.name: urlcolumn
parameter.help: Query column containing URL information to load when the user clicks the corresponding data point.

parameter.name: colorlist
parameter.help: Comma delimited list of colors to use for each data point.

parameter.name: showitemlabel
parameter.help: Specifies whether to put item labels on the horizontal axis of bar charts and the vertical axis of HorizontalBar charts.

parameter.name: legendfont
parameter.help: The font used to display the legend.

parameter.name: itemlabelfont
parameter.help: The font used for the item labels.

parameter.name: itemlabelsize
parameter.help: The size of the item labels, in points.

parameter.name: borderwidth
parameter.help: Border thickness, in pixels.

parameter.name: fill
parameter.help: Width of the graph line, in pixels.

parameter.name: scalefrom
parameter.help: The minimum value of the graph value axis (the vertical axis for Bar charts, the horizontal axis for HorizontalBar charts).

parameter.name: linewidth
parameter.help: Specifies whether to fill the area below the line with the line color to create an area graph.

parameter.name: valuecolumn
parameter.help: Query column that contains the data values. Required if you do not use cfgraphdata tags in the cfgraph tag body to specify the data values.

parameter.name: itemcolumn
parameter.help: Query column that contains the item label for the corresponding data point. The item labels appear in the chart legend.

parameter.name: bordercolor
parameter.help: Border color.

parameter.name: linecolor
parameter.help: The color used to draw the data line.

parameter.name: valuelocation
parameter.help: Where value labels are placed.

parameter.name: showlegend
parameter.help: The placement of the legend that identifies colors with the data labels.

parameter.name: fileformat
parameter.help: File type to be used for the output displayed in the browser.

parameter.name: graphheight
parameter.help: Height of the graph, in pixels. Default is 240.

parameter.name: itemlabelorientation
parameter.help: Orientation of item labels.

parameter.name: barspacing
parameter.help: Spacing between bars in the chart, in pixels.

parameter.name: depth
parameter.help: Depth of 3D chart appearance, in pixels.

parameter.name: backgroundcolor
parameter.help: Color of the chart background.

parameter.name: gridlines
parameter.help: An integer that specifies the number of grid lines to display on the chart between the top and bottom lines.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Title to display centered above the chart, or below the chart if the legend is above the chart.

tag.name: cfchartdata
tag.help: Used with the cfchart and cfchartseries tags. This tag defines chart data points. Its data is submitted to the cfchartseries tag.

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: string; data point name

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: number or expression; data point value

tag.name: cfhtmlhead
tag.help: Writes the text specified in the text attribute to the 'head' section of a generated HTML page. The cfhtmlhead tag can be useful for embedding JavaScript code, or placing other HTML tags such, as META, LINK, TITLE, or BASE in an HTML page header.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of variable to contain the text for htmlhead.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to add to the 'head' area of an HTML page. Everything inside the quotation marks is placed in the 'head' section

tag.name: cfqueryparam
tag.help: Checks the data type of a query parameter. The cfqueryparam tag is nested within a cfquery tag. It is embedded within the query SQL statement. If you specify its optional parameters, cfqueryparam also performs data validation.

parameter.name: null
parameter.help: Yes or No. Indicates whether the parameter is passed as a null. If Yes, the tag ignores the value attribute. The default is No.

parameter.name: cfsqltype
parameter.help: The SQL type that the parameter (any type) will be bound to.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of the parameter. The default value is the length of the string specified in the value attribute.

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: Yes or No. Indicates that the parameter value of the value attribute is a list of values, separated by a separator character. The default is No

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Specifies the actual value that Railo passes to the right of the comparison operator in a where clause.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Specifies the character that separates values in the list of parameter values in the value attribute. The default is a comma. If you specify a list of values for the value attribute, you must also specify the list attribute.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Number of decimal places of the parameter. The default value is zero.

tag.name: cfprocparam
tag.help: Specifies parameter information, including type, name, value, and length. The cfprocparam tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

parameter.name: null
parameter.help: Indicates whether the parameter is passed as a null. If you specify Yes, the tag ignores the value attribute.

parameter.name: cfsqltype
parameter.help: The SQL type that the parameter of any type is bound to.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: The variable name that you use to reference the value that the output parameter represents after the call is made to the stored procedure.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of the parameter.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Indicates whether the passed variable is an input, output or input/output variable. Default is IN. The value IN passes the parameter by value. Values OUT and INOUT pass parameters as bound variables.

parameter.name: dbvarname
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Corresponds to the actual value that Railo passes to the stored procedure.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Number of decimal places of the parameter.

tag.name: cfpop
tag.help: Retrieves and deletes e-mail messages from a POP mail server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the index query.

parameter.name: generateuniquefilenames
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to generate unique filenames for the files attached to an e-mail message to avoid naming conflicts when the files are saved. Default is NO.

parameter.name: attachmentpath
parameter.help: Allows attachments to be written to the specified directory when action = "getAll". If an invalid attachmentPath is specified, no attachment files are written to the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Defaults to the standard POP port, 110.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: Host name biff.upperlip.com or IP address 192.1.2.225 of the POP server.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Specifies the mail action.

parameter.name: messagenumber
parameter.help: Can be a comma-separated list of the message ids

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If no user name is specified, the POP connection is anonymous.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Sets the number of messages returned, starting with the number in the startRow attribute. This attribute is ignored if messageNumber is specified.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing. Defaults is 60 seconds.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Specifies the first row number to be retrieved. Default is 1. This attribute is ignored if messageNumber is specified.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password that corresponds to user name.

tag.name: cfpdfparam
tag.help: Provides additional information for the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag applies only to the merge action of the cfpdf tag and is always a child tag of the cfpdf tag.

parameter.name: pages
parameter.help: age or pages of the PDF source file to merge. You can specify a range of pages, for example, "1-5 ", or a comma-separated list of pages, for example, "1-5,9-10,18".

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: User or owner password, if the source PDF file is password-protected.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Source PDF file to merge. You can specify a PDF variable, a cfdocument variable, or the pathname to a file.

tag.name: cfselect
tag.help: Used inside cfform, cfselect lets you construct a drop-down list box form control. You can populate the drop-down list box from a query, or using the option tag. Use option elements to populate lists. The syntax for the option tag is the same as for its HTML counterpart.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help: HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfselect. If you specify an attribute and its value, the attribute and its value are passed to the HTML code that is generated for the cfselect tag.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Number of entries in the drop-down list.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message that displays if required = 'Yes' and no selection is made.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the form you are creating.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Yes or No. If Yes, a list element must be selected when the form is submitted, and the size of the drop-down list must be at least two. Default is No.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: The query column displayed. Defaults to the value of value. Used with the query attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: A value matching at least one entry in value to preselect the entry in the drop-down list box.

parameter.name: casesensitive
parameter.help: is compare for selected case sensitive or not

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The name of a valid JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

parameter.name: multiple
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes permits selection of multiple elements in the drop-down list box. The default is No.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The query column value for the list element. Used with the query attribute.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of the query to be used to populate the drop-down list box.

tag.name: cfindex
tag.help: Populates collections with indexed data. The cfindex and cfsearch tags encapsulate the indexing and searching utilities. Collections can be populated from text files in a directory you specify, or from a query generated by a query. Before you can populate a collection, you must create the collection using either the cfcollection tag or the Railo Administrator. Use cfsearch to search collections you populate with cfindex.

parameter.name: recurse
parameter.help: Yes or No. Yes specifies, if type = "Path", that directories below the path specified in key are included in the indexing operation.

parameter.name: custom4
parameter.help: A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation. Usage is the same as for custom1.

parameter.name: custom3
parameter.help: A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation. Usage is the same as for custom1.

parameter.name: custom2
parameter.help: A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation. Usage is the same as for custom1.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the type of entity being indexed. Default is CUSTOM.

parameter.name: custom1
parameter.help: A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type and a query name.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the query against which the collection is generated.

parameter.name: external
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: the timeout in seconds for a single request of type url

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: Specifies a collection name. If you are indexing an external collection external = "Yes", specify the collection name, including fully qualified path.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Specifies the index action.

parameter.name: urlpath
parameter.help: Specifies the URL path for files if type = "file" and type = "path". When the collection is searched with cfsearch, the pathname is automatically be prepended to filenames and returned as the url attribute.

parameter.name: extensions
parameter.help: Specifies the comma-separated list of file extensions that Railo uses to index files if type = "Path". Default is HTM, HTML, CFM, CFML, DBM, DBML. An entry of "*." returns files with no extension

parameter.name: throwontimeout
parameter.help: Specifies how timeout conditions are handled. If the value is true, an exception is enerated to provide notification of the timeout. If the value is No, execution continues. Default is no.

parameter.name: title

tag.name: cfwhile
tag.help: same like loop-contition but easier to use

parameter.name: condition
parameter.help: Contition o the expression

tag.name: cflocation
tag.help: Opens a CFML page or HTML file. For example, you might use cflocation to specify a standard message or response that you use in several applications. Use the addToken attribute to verify client requests.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: The URL of the HTML file or CFML page to open.

parameter.name: statuscode
parameter.help: statuscode used for the redirect (301 or 302)

parameter.name: addtoken
parameter.help: Yes or No. clientManagement must be enabled, see cfapplication. Yes appends client variable information to the URL you specify in the url.

tag.name: cfgridrow
tag.help: Lets you define a cfgrid that does not use a query as source for row data. If a query attribute is specified in cfgrid, the cfgridrow tags are ignored.

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: A comma-separated list of column values. If a column value contains a comma character, it must be escaped with a second comma character.

tag.name: cfmodule
tag.help: Invokes a custom tag for use in cfml templates. The cfmodule tag can help deal with custom tag name conflicts. Use the template attribute to name a template that contains the custom tag definition, including its path..

tag.name: cfinput
tag.help: Used inside cfform to place radio buttons, checkboxes, or text boxes. Provides input validation for the specified control type.

parameter.name: onselect
parameter.help: the html attribute onselect

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Enter Yes or No. Default is No.

parameter.name: tabindex
parameter.help: the html attribute tabIndex

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help: HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfinput. If you specify an attribute and value, they are passed to the HTML code generated for the cfinput tag.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: The JavaScript regular expression pattern to use to validate the input. Required only if you specify validate = "regular_expression".

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function you want to execute in the event of a failed validation.

parameter.name: onmouseover
parameter.help: the html attribute onMouseOver

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: the html attribute onMouseDown

parameter.name: onblur
parameter.help: the html attribute onBlur

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function used to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return true if validation succeeds and false otherwise. If used, the validate attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: onfocus
parameter.help: the html attribute onFocus

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Enter a minimum and maximum value range, separated by a comma. Valid only for numeric data.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: The size of the input control. Ignored if type is Radio or Checkbox.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: An initial value for the form input element.

parameter.name: onmouseout
parameter.help: the html attribute onMouseOut

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: the html attribute onMouseUp

parameter.name: onkeyup
parameter.help: the html attribute onKeyUp

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: the html attribute id

parameter.name: onkeydown
parameter.help: the html attribute onKeyDown

parameter.name: onkeypress
parameter.help: the html attribute onKeyPress

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: the html attribute style

parameter.name: ondblclick
parameter.help: the html attribute onDblclick

parameter.name: onmousemove
parameter.help: the html attribute onMouseMove

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: the html attribute onClick

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A name for the form input element.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: the html attribute class

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: the html attribute onChange

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: The maximum length of text entered, if n type is Text.

tag.name: cfxml
tag.help: Creates a CFML XML document object that contains the markup in the tag body. This tag can include XML and CFML tags. Railo processes the CFML code in the tag body, then assigns the resulting text to an XML document object variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: name of an xml variable

parameter.name: casesensitive
parameter.help: yes: maintains the case of document elements and attributes

tag.name: cfservletparam
tag.help: This tag has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

tag.name: cfimap
tag.help: Retrieves and deletes e-mail messages from a Imap mail server.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the index query.

parameter.name: generateuniquefilenames
parameter.help: Boolean indicating whether to generate unique filenames for the files attached to an e-mail message to avoid naming conflicts when the files are saved. Default is NO.

parameter.name: attachmentpath
parameter.help: Allows attachments to be written to the specified directory when action = "getAll". If an invalid attachmentPath is specified, no attachment files are written to the server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Defaults to the standard Imap port, 143.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: Host name biff.upperlip.com or IP address 192.1.2.225 of the Imap server.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Specifies the mail action.

parameter.name: messagenumber
parameter.help: Can be a comma-separated list of the message ids

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: If no user name is specified, the Imap connection is anonymous.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Sets the number of messages returned, starting with the number in the startRow attribute. This attribute is ignored if messageNumber is specified.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing. Defaults is 60 seconds.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Specifies the first row number to be retrieved. Default is 1. This attribute is ignored if messageNumber is specified.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password that corresponds to user name.

tag.name: cfsleep
tag.help: Pauses the execution of the page for a given interval

parameter.name: time
parameter.help: Expressed in milli seconds.

scopevar.name: Client
scopevar.help: Client scope variables

scopevar.name: AUTH_TYPE
scopevar.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

scopevar.name: AUTH_USER
scopevar.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the username the user has authenticated as. (Also available as AUTH_USER.)

scopevar.name: CERT_ISSUER
scopevar.help: Information about the authority that provided the client certificate

scopevar.name: CERT_SUBJECT
scopevar.help: Client-specific information provided by the web server. This data typically includes the client's name, e-mail address, and so on

scopevar.name: CONTENT_LENGTH
scopevar.help: Length of the content as given by the client.

scopevar.name: CONTENT_TYPE
scopevar.help: For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.

scopevar.name: GATEWAY_INTERFACE
scopevar.help: CGI specification revision with which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.

scopevar.name: HTTP_REFERER
scopevar.help: The referring document that linked to or submitted form data.

scopevar.name: HTTP_USER_AGENT
scopevar.help: The browser that the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.

scopevar.name: QUERY_STRING
scopevar.help: Query information that follows the ? in the URL that referenced this script.

scopevar.name: REMOTE_ADDR
scopevar.help: IP address of the remote host making the request.

scopevar.name: REMOTE_HOST
scopevar.help: Hostname making the request. If the server does not have this information, it sets REMOTE_ADDR and does not set REMOTE_HOST.

scopevar.name: REMOTE_USER
scopevar.help: If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, the username the user has authenticated as. (Also available as AUTH_USER.)

scopevar.name: REQUEST_METHOD
scopevar.help: Method with which the request was made. For HTTP, this is Get, Head, Post, and so on.

scopevar.name: SCRIPT_NAME
scopevar.help: Virtual path to the script that is executing; used for self-referencing URLs.

scopevar.name: SERVER_NAME
scopevar.help: Server's hostname, DNS alias, or IP address as it appears in self-referencing URLs.

scopevar.name: SERVER_PORT
scopevar.help: Port number to which the request was sent.

scopevar.name: SERVER_PROTOCOL
scopevar.help: Name and revision of the information protocol this request came in with. Format: protocol/revision.

scopevar.name: SERVER_SOFTWARE
scopevar.help: Name and version of the information server software answering the request (and running the gateway). Format: name/version.

scopevar.name: Server
scopevar.help: Client scope variables

scopevar.name: CurrentRow
scopevar.help: Current row of query that cfoutput is processing.

scopevar.name: RecordCount
scopevar.help: Number of records (rows) returned from the query.

scopevar.name: ColumnList
scopevar.help: Comma-separated list of the query columns.

scope.help: ColdFusion product name, usually "ColdFusion Server"
ColdFusion product release information. Comma seperated list of build numbers, first number is the major build number. Example: 7,0,1,116466
ColdFusion product level information, for example: "Professional", "Enterprise", or "Developer"
ColdFusion serial number.
Locales supported by ColdFusion, comma seperated.
Expiration date of ColdFusion.
Directory ColdFusion is installed to Example: C:\CFusionMX7
Name of J2EE Application server, for stand-alone ColdFusion the value is "JRun4".
Type of installation method. Example: Native Windows
Server operating system name.
Information about the host operating system.
Operating system version.
The computer architecture, Windows computers are: x86
Build number of the host operating system.
Name of the application set with the cfapplication tag, or in Application.cfc
The application name. If you do not set this variable, or set it to the empty string, your CFC applies to the unnamed application scope, which is the ColdFusion MX J2EE servlet context.
Life span, as a real number of days, of the application, including all Application scope variables. Use the CFML CreateTimeSpan function to generate this variable's value.
Whether the application supports Client scope variables.
Where Client variables are stored; can be cookie, registry, or the name of a data source.
Whether to store login information in the Cookie scope or the Session scope.
Whether the application supports Session scope variables.
Life span, as a real number of days, of the user session, including all Session variables. Use the CFML CreateTimeSpan function to generate this variable's value.
Whether to send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to the client browser.
Whether to set CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not just a host).
Whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks.
Unique client ID. Part of the session key.
Unique ID. Part of the session key.
Number of client visits.
Date and time of the last visit.
Date and time of first visit.
CFID combined with CFTOKEN. Example: CFID=123&CFTOKEN=45678
Unique Session ID. Part of the session key.
Unique Session ID. Part of the session key.
CFID combined with CFTOKEN Eexample: CFID=123&CFTOKEN=45678
A unique identifier for the session. ColdFusion session management: a combination of the application name and CFID and CFToken values. J2EE session management: the jsessionid value.
A custom tag template may be invoked in either of two modes: "Start" tag execution and "End" tag execution. "Inactive" is another possible value, but for unknown purposes.
Used for code validation, it distinguishes between custom tags that have and don't have end tags for ExecutionMode='start'. The name of the Boolean value is ThisTagHasEndTag.
Custom tags can access and modify the generated content of any of its instances using the ThisTag.GeneratedContent variable.
Holds the attributes of all nested tags if CFASSOCIATE has used them.
Specifies whether or not ColdFusion attempted to save a file.
Full path of the uploaded file on the clients system.
Filename of the uploaded file on the clients system.
Extension of the uploaded file on the clients system without a period.
Filename without an extension of the uploaded file on the client's system.
MIME content subtype of the saved file.
MIME content type of the saved file.
Date and time the uploaded file was last accessed.
Specifies whether or not the file already existed with the same path.
Size of the uploaded file.
Specifies whether or not ColdFusion appended a file to an existing file.
Specifies whether or not ColdFusion overwrote a file.
Specifies whether or not the uploaded file was renamed to avoid a name conflict.
Specifies whether or not ColdFusion saved a file.
Size of a file that was overwritten in the file upload operation.
Full path of the file actually saved.
Filename of the file actually saved.
Extension of the uploaded file on the server, without a period Example: txt
Filename, without an extension, of the uploaded file on the server.
Time the uploaded file was created.
Date and time of the last modification to the uploaded file.
The result value depending on the action performed, as follows: getCurrentDir = current directory (string) getCurrentURL = current URL (string) existsDir = yes/no existsFile = yes/no exists = yes/no
Yes or No dependent on value of ErrorCode.
Error code.
Text associated with ErrorCode.
ListDir Query Field: Filename of the current element.
ListDir Query Field: File path (without the drive designation) of the current element.
ListDir Query Field: Complete URL for the current element (file or directory).
ListDir Query Field: Number indicating file size of the current element.
ListDir Query Field: Unformatted date/time value of the current element.
ListDir Query Field: Indicates attributes of the current element.
ListDir Query Field: Indicates whether object is a file or directory.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Whether the user is authenticated
A comma-delimited list of the user's groups in the specified domain. The structure includes this field only if the listGroups attribute is Yes.
The user name; equals the tag's name attribute.

The authentication status. One of the following: - success - UserNotInDirFailure: the user is not listed in the directory. - AuthenticationFailure: the user is in the directory, but the password is not valid.
Returns file attributes, if applicable.
Returns the date an entry was last modified.
Directory containing the entry.
(Deprecated) Empty value for backward compatibility with ColdFusion 5 on UNIX.
Returns the directory or file entry name. ( "." and ".." aren't returned since 6.0)
Returns the size of directory or file entry.
Returns entry type: "File" or "Dir".
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Registry value name.
Data type.
Registry value data.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Value of URLpath attribute in the cfindex tag used to populate a collection.
Value of the key attribute in the cfindex tag used to populate a collection.

Value of title attribute in cfindex tag used to populate the collection, including PDF and Office document titles. If a title is not extracted from the document, the tag uses the cfindex title attribute value for each row.
Relevancy score of document based on search criteria, from 0-1. Example: 0.92 (would be 92%)
Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.
Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.
A context summary containing the search terms, highlighted in bold (by default). This is enabled if you set the contextpassages attribute to a number greater than zero.
Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.
Value of custom fields in cfindex tag used to populate a collection.
The number of bytes in the index document.
The rank of this document in the search results.
Extracted from the HTML, Office, and PDF documents when available.
The MIME type of the document. Example: text/html
A list of the categories that were specified for this document when it was indexed.
A hierarchical category tree, or serial list of categories, that was specified for this document when it was indexed. Only a single tree is returned.
Number of records searched. This is the same value for each row in the record set. Corresponds to the searched key in the status structure.
Contents of automatic summary generated by cfindex.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Collection has category support enabled or disabled.
The character set of the collection.
The date and time that the collection was created.
The number of documents in this collection.
- yes: the collection is external. - no: the collection is not external. - Not Found: the collection is registered but is not available in the defined path .
The locale setting of the collection. (This information is not available for K2Server collections.)
The date and time that the collection was last changed.
The name of the collection.
Absolute path to the collection.
The size of the collection, expressed in kilobytes.
Obsolete. The collection is mapped. (This information is not available for K2Server collections.)
Obsolete. The collection can be searched. (If EXTERNAL = "Not Found", this value is "No".)
Obsolete. - CF: collection is registered by ColdFusion - K2: collection is registered by K2Server
Status code for the stored procedure. (only when returnCode="true")
Execution time for the request in milliseconds. (only when returnCode="true")
Contains a tab-separated list of all original attachment names. (only when action="getall")
Contains a tab-separated list of the actual temporary filenames written to the server. (only when action="getall")
Body of message. (only when action="getall")
Text Body of message. (only when action="getall")
HTML Body of message. (only when action="getall")
CC value from message header.
Date sent value from message header.
From value from message header.
Entire message header. (only when action="getall")
Sequential message number of message on POP server.
The mail header Message-ID field.
ReplyTo value from message header.
Subject value from message header.
To value from message header.
Column list, comma seperated.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Unique identifier for the e-mail message file. (mail header X-UID field)

Structure that contains key-value pairs. The keys are the names of image files that are embedded in the e-mail message; the values are their cids. You can use the cid to find the correct place of an image in an HTML e-mail message that the cfpop tag retrieves. If the e-mail message contains more than one embedded image, only the last embedded image is available.
The SQL statement that was executed.
If the query was cached.
An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Execution time for the SQL request.
The current row of the query in a loop.
Total number of records in the query.
Column list, comma seperated.
Response character character set (character encoding) specified by the response Content-Type header.

If the connection to the HTTP server fails, contains details about the failure. For instance: "Unknown host: my.co.com"; otherwise, the empty string. Macromedia recommends that you check this variable for an error condition before checking other variables.
Response body; for example: the contents of a html page retrieved by a GET operation. Empty if you save the response in a file.
Raw response header containing all header information in a single string. Contains the same information as the #cfhttp.responseHeader# variable.
MIME type specified by the response Content-Type header, Example: text/html

The response headers formatted into a structure. Each element key is the header name, such as Content-Type or Status_Code. If there is more than one instance of a header type, the type values are put in an array. One common technique is to dynamically access the cfhttp.responseHeader structure as a dynamic array, example: #cfhttp.resonseHeader[fieldVariable]#
The HTTP status_code header value followed by the HTTP Explanation header value. Example: 200 OK

Boolean; True if the response body content type is text. ColdFusion recognizes the response body as text if: The header does not specify a content type, or it starts with "text" or "message" or the full content type="application/octet-stream".
All HTTP headers that were not already parsed into one of the listed variables. These variables are of the form HTTP_header field name with each variable separated by a semi-colon

(IIS) Retrieves all headers in raw form. The difference between CGI.ALL_RAW and CGI.ALL_HTTP is that CGI.ALL_HTTP places an HTTP_ prefix before the header name and the header name is always capitalized. In ALL_RAW the header name and values appear as they are sent by the client.

(IIS) Returns the name of the application pool that is running in the IIS worker process that is handling the request. There is also an CGI.APP_POOL_ID environment variable that is available to applications that are running in the IIS worker process. (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)
(IIS) Retrieves the metabase path of the application.
(IIS) Retrieves the physical path corresponding to the metabase path in CGI.APPL_MD_PATH.
(IIS) The value entered in the client's authentication dialog. This variable is available only if Basic authentication is used.
If the server supports user authentication, and the script is protected, this is the protocol-specific authentication method used to validate the user.

(IIS) The name of the user as it is derived from the authorization header sent by the client, before the user name is mapped to a Windows account. This variable is no different from CGI.REMOTE_USER. If you have an authentication filter installed on your Web server that maps incoming users to accounts, use CGI.LOGON_USER to view the mapped user name.
(IIS) Returns the full URL Example: http://www.macromedia.com:80/index.cfm?query=string (Note: IIS 5.1 and earlier: This server variable is not available.)
(IIS) Unique ID for the client certificate, returned as a string. This can be used as a signature for the whole client certificate.

(IIS) bit0 is set to 1 if the client certificate is present. bit1 is set to 1 if the certification authority of the client certificate is invalid (that is, it is not in the list of recognized certification authorities on the server). If bit 1 of CGI.CERT_FLAGS is set to 1, indicating that the certificate is invalid, IIS version 4.0 and later will reject the certificate. (Note: Earlier versions of IIS will not reject the certificate.)
Issuer field of the client certificate (O=MS, OU=IAS, CN=user name, C=USA).
(IIS) Number of bits in the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection key size. Example: 128
(IIS) Number of bits in server certificate private key. Example: 1024
(IIS) Serial number field of the client certificate.
(IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.
(IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.
Subject field of the client certificate.
Show the entire file path to the coldfusion template, similar to CGI.PATH_TRANSLATED. Example: c:\inetpub\wwwroot\somesite\somepage.cfm
The length of the content as given by the client.
For queries that have attached information, such as HTTP POST and PUT, this is the content type of the data.
(Apache SSI) The current date and time in Greenwich Mean Time (now Unviversal Co-ordinated Time (UCT) in the default or #config defined format). Thursday, 03-May-2001 21:18:54 GMT
(Apache SSI) The current date and time in the local (server) timezone (in the default or #config defined format), Example: Thursday, 03-May-2001 17:18:54 EDT

(Zeus SSI) This will be set to the CGI.QUERY_STRING of the master document. The value of CGI.QUERY_STRING for an SSI sub-request will contain the query string in the sub-request URL, if present, else the master document's CGI.QUERY_STRING.
(Apache SSI) The file name (excludes directories) of the document requested by the user. Example: ssi.htm
(Apache SSI/Zeus SSI) This will be set to the CGI.PATH_INFO of the master document.
(Apache SSI) The root directory of this site defined by the 'DocumentRoot' directive in the General Section or a <virtualhost> section. Example: /var/www/zytrax
(Apache SSI/Zeus SSI) The URL path of the document requested by the user. Example: /tech/web/ssi.htm
The revision of the CGI specification to which this server complies. Format: CGI/revision.
List of Content-types the browser can accept (defined by the HTTP Accept header).
(IIS) Returns a list of accepted encoding types. Example: gzip, deflate
(IIS) Returns a string describing the language to use for displaying content.
(IIS) Returns a string describing the connection type. Example: Keep-Alive
(IIS) Returns the cookie string that was included with the request.
(IIS) Returns the name of the Web server. This may or may not be the same as CGI.SERVER_NAME depending on type of name resolution you are using on your Web server (IP address, host header).
(IIS) The method used to make the request (Note: same as CGI.REQUEST_METHOD).
The referring document. The document that linked to or submitted form data.
(IIS) Returns the raw, encoded URL. Example: /vdir/default.asp?querystring
The browser the client is currently using to send the request. Format: software/version library/version.
(IIS) The name and version of the request protocol (the raw form of CGI.SERVER_PROTOCOL).
(IIS/Zeus) Returns ON if the request came in through a secure channel; or it returns OFF, if the request is for an insecure channel. Example: SSL
(IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the SSL connection key size. Example: 128
(IIS/Zeus) Number of bits in the server certificate private key. Example: 1024
(IIS) Issuer field of the server certificate.
(IIS) Subject field of the server certificate.
